I wanted to tell him I loved him too. I knew that now. Funny how I only realized it after he was dead. I wanted to answer his feelings properly. But I couldn’t now. He’d never get to hear those words. Why had I been so stupid? So blind?

I blinked a few times and realized I was standing in the living room. When had I gotten here? When had we left the school? I needed to go back there. He might still be alive. It was possible. He could have escaped. He wasn’t allowed to be dead until I told him how I felt. Please god, just let him be alive! Let him somehow escape!

I turned to leave the room, fully intending to walk back to the school when my dad stepped in front of door and shook his head.

“It’s best if you stay inside honey. Billy told us what happened and I was out there. It’s not safe right now.”

“But he’s alive! He needs my help!”

“If he is still alive then the police will handle it. If you go out now you will end up getting killed and he wouldn’t want that now would he? There is rioting in the streets and a lot of madness all over town. It probably won’t reach this section though and the military is already enforcing order. I don’t want you to get caught up in it.”

Then what am I supposed to do?”

I heard the lost and pleading tone of my voice but didn’t care. The world was ending. Chris was dead and nothing my dad was saying made much sense. This was Gorgon City, where nothing really bad happened. There was no way there could be rioting. No way Chris could actually be dead. This was like what happened in a dream.

That was it! This was all a dream! I would wake up and none of this will have happened! All I needed to do was pinch myself awake. After all, Chris couldn’t cut off someone’s arm or climb trees without using his hands. He couldn’t do any of the stuff I had seen him do. He would never say the things he had said. Leaving me or Billy alone in a real crises and simply telling us to run home. That wasn’t like him.

I pinched my arm but nothing happened except I felt the sharp pain where I had grabbed. Maybe the arm wasn’t a good spot, maybe my cheek would be better. Still nothing. I had to find someplace more painful. I had to wake up.

My mom touched my arm, shaking her head when I looked at her.

“It’s not a dream sweetie. Doing that will do no good.”

I felt the tears beginning to well up again as she took me in her arms and rocked me back and forth.

“It’s ok sweetie. Maybe he did make it out. If he did I just know he will come running over here straight away. When he does I bet he is going to be really hungry. So let’s set a plate for him at lunch ok? You can cry your eyes out and make yourself look nice so he doesn’t have to worry about you when he comes. You know he will worry if you aren’t your usual self, because that’s just how he is. Now why don’t you help me prepare lunch ok?”

I slowly nodded my head against her chest and let her lead me towards the kitchen. She was right. He would come running as soon as he could. He always came running. He always found me when I was lost. Always knew the right things to say to make me feel better. And right now I was really lost and needed to hear his voice. Even if it was to make fun of me.

“Poor girl. She just can’t accept that he is dead. What is it about you mortals anyway? Whenever someone dies you almost always beg me to give them back to you. Yet ninety percent of the rest of the time you are either cursing my name or don’t believe I exist. It’s not all that easy to bring a person back to life you know. There is a natural order to things. Even I can’t mess with that order easily.”

“What did you think? I would make light of this situation? I’m not that heartless. I can appreciate such somber moments of loss as well. Even if I can’t completely understand it. Losing something or someone precious is always hard to handle. I hope she can get over this soon.”

I blinked and found myself staring at my reflection in the bathroom mirror. How long had I been standing here? How long had the water been running? Slowly I turned the faucet off and looked at my reflection again. My long blond hair seemed to have lost some of its luster and my blue eyes were rimmed red from so much crying. They had lost some of the life in them as well. Was this really what I looked like? I needed to fix this. I couldn’t let Chris see me like this. He would make fun of me for sure.

I ran a comb through my hair, holding it up in a few different positions. Deciding to wear it in a ponytail. He always had liked ponytails. Once that was done I used a bit of make-up and water to clear away the worst of the red around my eyes. When he came for lunch I would waste no time in telling him how I felt. He would like that. But that meant I had to be strong, I couldn’t cry anymore.

After leaving the bathroom I headed for the stairs. While passing Billy’s room I heard muffled sobs through his door. My own eyes began to water again, threatening to undo all the work I had just done. Clenching my fists I walked away. Chris was still alive after all.

Lunchtime drew near and I began to get anxious. What would he say to my confession? Would he kiss me again? Did I want him to kiss me again in front of my family? Would he laugh at how worried I was about him? If he did I would smack him. But that was just like him too. To simply laugh off a serious event like this.

As we sat around the table everyone seemed to be forcing themselves to act cheerful for my sake. I wasn’t worried. I knew he would come. I had set a plate out for him after all. I had piled it with mashed potatoes, some peas, and topped his hamburger steak with mushrooms. He loved mushrooms. It was ready and waiting for him. Now all he had to do was come over.

The doorbell rang just as I was about to put my first forkful of food in my mouth. I dropped it back to my plate as I bounded out of my chair. He was here! Just like my mom said he would be. I knew he wasn’t dead! I could feel my cheeks stretched to their fullest as I yanked open the door. My grin disappearing in an instant when I saw it was old Miss Haubenaker from across the street.

“Chelsea dear! What are you doing home? Shouldn’t you be in school?”

My hand dropped listlessly from the door as I turned to shuffle back to the table. My mom came around the corner and saw who it was while I moved away, all my energy suddenly gone again. I heard the old woman ask to borrow some sugar but I didn’t care. She wasn’t Chris.

Lunchtime passed but still he didn’t show up. I refused to let anyone take his plate off the table. He was going to be hungry when he came and hamburger steak was his favorite. Mom put some cling wrap over it but otherwise left it alone. With a sigh I shuffled into the living room and plopped down on the couch. aimlessly picking up the remote and flicking through the channels.

“At eight fifty three this morning Heronus middle school exploded from an attack made by a terrorist group calling themselves the Inquisition. Police and firefighters have been working tirelessly to clear the wreckage. Of the two hundred and twenty three children that attend this school only twenty two are still alive. Those who did not attend school today for whatever reason were the only ones not killed by the explosion. No other survivors have been found. A copy of the official attendance records for this morning are being pulled off an external server and the families of the victims are being notified as we speak. Stay tuned to GCNS for more info.”

No survivors. Of course there would be no survivors. It was impossible to survive a blast like that. I had been there after all. I knew there was no chance anyone could survive that. I let the remote drop back to the couch as my hands covered my face and I began to cry. The cushions next to me shifted as Billy sat down next to me. I latched on to him just like he latched onto me, our tears mingling together.

111212.title: Don't shoot

112.content:
Tch. I had hoped I could have had a good throw down with someone strong. But it had only been Chris. I’d traded fists with him a few times, so I already knew how strong he was. Come to think of it, he was ahead of me three-two, with one tie. Perhaps he would spar with me again after the test. Though I had to admit, he had style. I held no illusions. I was your average brawler. I had a few moves on me but I took care of business with brute strength, nothing else. I didn’t have the kind of skill Chris had. That ability to assess the opponent and strike at the weak points. But I had stamina to make up for that lack.

My phone rang while I was waiting on the bus to head back home. I already knew it was my older sister before even pulling it out of my pocket since hers was the only Rotten Oranges ring tone on my phone. I briefly toyed with the idea of ignoring her but in the end I just couldn’t. She was family. Even though I knew she was probably calling because she wanted to use my strength.

“Yeah what do you want sis?”

“Where are you right now?”

“Bus stop in Medusa city. Watching my ride come down the street now. Why?”

“Perfect. Come over to the shopping district would you? I’m in a bit of trouble here.”

“Let me guess, trouble of the violent boy kind?”

“It’s not my fault! They just hit on me and I turned them down. They just wouldn’t take no for an answer.”

“Uh-huh. And I bet you turned them down in your normal sweet way.”

“I only told them to leave me alone.”

“And probably slapped them at least once.”

“How’d you know!”

“I’m psychic.”

I let out a sigh as I let the bus door close in front of me and turned to head towards the shopping district at a jog.

“I’ll be there in about ten minutes. Can you hold out for that long?”

“Yeah I’m in MayB’s now buying some clothes. They are hanging around outside waiting for me.”

“How many?”

“Just four of them. But one of them is a kickback. I’m not sure which one or what his power is but I can sense it.”

“That’s fine. I’m almost there, when I tell you to move leave the store and head into the nearest alley. I’ll box them in.”

“Thanks bro. I knew I could count on you.”

“Seems like the only time you count on me is when you are in trouble. Would be nice to hear from you once in a while when you weren’t.”

“What was that? I couldn’t hear you. There was too much noise in the background.”

“Nothing at all sis.”

I snapped the phone closed and began pumping my hands, getting serious with my run. So there was a kickback huh? Wonder from what hero, angel, or demon he descended from. If the world at large knew there were still people out there with paranormal powers they would freak out. Or want to study us. I knew I got my freakish strength and stamina from Hercules, though no one else in my family since my great-grandfather had gotten any of it. It was a family secret.

Robin’s ability to sense when other kickbacks were nearby was passed down by her mother from my dad’s last marriage. It was no wonder we had hit it off so well when she had moved in with us, one kickback finding safety in another of their kind. Our parents were supportive of us, sometimes annoyingly so, but they didn’t understand our unique position or the pain having this power sometimes caused us.

“Interesting. This is a descendant of one of my son’s. I even remember Hercules. Good lad. A bit daft in the head mind you but still a good lad. Did a lot of good too. Gave your world hope when you needed it. Wonder who this other one is though? Won’t know what son or daughter spawned him until I see his power. It does make me feel good that some people haven’t completely forgotten their roots and the ones that gave them their abilities.”

“Tell me. What do you think? Did I do the right thing in letting those with power live so long ago? If I had put an end to all of them these people would not have these skills. Would that have altered history? Would these situations and confrontations never happen? Oh I’m just fooling with you! I know they would never happen. I’m a god remember? What? Did you really take me serious for a moment? Loosen up, have some fun.”

I ended up across the street from MayB’s Clothing and accessories exactly nine minutes after I started out. Not even slightly out of breath. I grinned to myself as I began dialing my sisters phone. That was one boon I had gotten from my ancient ancestor that I would always be grateful for, rarely getting winded.

I quickly told her I was here and got her acknowledgement before hanging up again. A moment later she came out of the store laden down with a bag on each arm and a few boxes. She looked around a moment before heading down the street. I saw four guys peel away from the shadows to follow her. One of them sported a red welt on his cheek still. Yeah they were definitely looking for trouble.

I let them get a few steps ahead and followed them on my side of the street. When Robin turned down the nearest alley and the four followed I finally crossed quickly to be only a few steps behind them. As soon as the last two entered the mouth I was already stepping up behind them and grabbing the sides of their heads. I smashed them together before they had a chance to realize I was there. Two down for the count.

I took a step forward just as the next one in line started to turn at the sound of the falling bodies. His mouth began to open and I grabbed his face in my meaty palm, muffling his exclamation seconds before slamming his head into the brick wall . Three down for the count.

I swung at the back of the fourth ones head even while I was dropping the third one. But my fist hit empty air. I looked around quickly for my target. He hadn’t ducked or jumped, he had just seemed to vanish. He must be the kickback..

“Looking for me stupid?”

I looked up at the guy who was standing on the fire escape grinning down on me cockily.

“Ah speed. Must be Hemiphisita’s stock. Though you might know her better as Hermes. How you mortals could mistake her for a boy I have no idea. But then again, those Greeks had some funny ideas about things too. Wonder how muscles will handle this one.”

I blinked and he was gone from the fire escape. Suddenly I felt a fist in my gut and then another across my jaw. A rapid flurry of attacks staggered me a moment as I took blow after blow too fast to see.

“No one is as fast as me. A big lumbering ox like you moves like molasses.”

The blows hurt, but they really weren’t all that powerful. It was just the speed that gave them more force then a normal person. But they had a pattern to them. Two quick jabs then a kick. Then a pause as it seemed he jumped back for a moment before coming in again. I waited until the kick came. During the pause I summoned all my strength and stomped the ground. I saw the cement vibrate as a small earthquake fanned out from my foot.

Suddenly the guy was visible right in front of me as he was thrown off balance. With a grin I curled my fingers into a fist and smashed him in the face. As he reeled back I caught him with an uppercut that lifted him off the ground. He was unconscious before his chin left my knuckles. Robin came walking up to me, stopping only long enough to kick the guy I had just knocked out.

“Thanks again bro.”

“Whatever.”

I grabbed the boxes out of her hands and then the bags, heading back to the street.

“Come on, I’ll walk you home.”

“You don’t have to.”

“I know I don’t. But if I leave you alone you will probably get in more trouble and call me up again when I’m halfway home. Besides, you don’t live all that far from here right?”

“You really are a good guy.”

“Don’t let that get out, I have a reputation to maintain.”

“What about these guys?”

“Probably wake up with massive headaches in a few hours. Just common trash. They will have forgotten all about you by tomorrow. If anything they will be more focused on me anyway, looking for revenge.”

“So what will you do if they come after you again?”

I shrugged. “Same thing I do all the other times I clean up your messes. I take care of it.”

“How is that exactly? You never will tell me.”

“And I’m not going to. They don’t bother you anymore do they?”

“No.”

“Then leave it at that.”

There was no way I would tell her the truth. That if I couldn’t run them out of town I killed them. It wouldn’t stop her from acting the way she did. Or being as impulsive as ever. It would only make her worry for no reason. I didn’t like killing anyone. But if it was to protect Robin I was willing to silently suffer.

We made it to her house without any more problems and I dropped my burden on her table before turning to leave. She quickly hugged me and kissed my cheek, telling me thank you again before closing the door. I smiled a bit as I rubbed my cheek and headed down the steps.

“Oh a bit of illicit love going on. Secret crush perhaps. This might prove even better then the whole Chel and Chris line. Something to be said about a steamy romance between siblings. Even parent and child. What? I’m a god remember? You can’t expect me to follow your human ideas and ideals. Ah well, let’s see where our smitten hero takes us shall we?”
112.title: Richard seems interesting...

1121.content:
Now that I had walked Robin home I decided to stop by the arcade for a bit. It wouldn’t take me too far out of my way now. Just a few hours to make sure my sister wouldn’t call me up again out of the blue because she went out again and got in trouble. That would be just like her, see some commercial and feel that she just had to have some item or another. Running out of her house half naked to buy it and provoking more guys to hit on her.

The neon sign that simply proclaimed Arcade came into view just as the bells began to ring signaling that it was five o’clock. I slipped in the doors just as the last echoes of the towers faded away, changing out a five dollar bill for some quarters at the machine. Looking around I saw most of the popular machines were already taken. Well it was a Friday evening so it wasn’t too surprising. But Dance Dance Jammer Two was open. Not a lot of people liked the game but I found it enjoyable

Popping a dollar into the machine I stepped up onto the platform. I selected medium difficulty and a random song as I shook out my shoulders and bounced on my feet a bit to limber up. I wasn’t even going to attempt Insanity mode. I had seen professional DDJ dancers tackle that and come out looking like they had been in a war. Rumor was Insanity mode had been thrown in as a sort of troll device by the developers, designed to make you freak out.

The character I had chosen walked onto the stage and turned to face me as the song rolled up the screen. Fighting Fantastic. I had never heard this song before, though from the beat that started in the background it was a fast paced one. It began to beep as it counted down from five until it hit zero.

“Level one. Begin!”

I let my feet hit the arrows as they scrolled up the screen. I missed a few but that was fine. I was no master after all. I enjoyed the song more then the game itself. I didn’t try anything flashy like other people, there was no need, it was just showing off.

“Congratulations! Level Up!”

Now the arrows began to speed up and I started missing them more often. Not that much more often but I still noticed. A gauge appeared on the left side of the screen while my avatar danced with me. As I hit notes it slowly filled with fire. When it hit the top it exploded in a shower of electronic ecstasy.

“On fire! Double points! Level Up!”

As the song wound down I let my feet fly as the arrows sped up again. At the very end I felt like being flashy, crossing my legs and doing a spin before stomping down on the last note. My score came up and the game gave me an A rank with a ninety out of one hundred percent. I heard a few claps behind me and looked to see some of the other kids in the arcade cheering me on.

“Big man got some moves.”

Before I could answer the guy the screen beeped.

“Incoming challenger! Progressive battle! Accept?”

I tried looking around the edge of the booth to see who was challenging me from the other side but couldn’t catch a glimpse. With a shrug I hit the accept button before putting on the virtual gloves. A few more kids were gathering around as another avatar walked onto the screen and put up her fists in a fighting stance. The red fist of the attacker popped up in the corner of my screen as a song began to play. It was one I knew pretty well and had danced to quite a few times.

“Level One. Begin. Attacker.”

As I danced and hit the arrows my avatar began to throw punches and kicks based on how well I hit the notes. The longer I could hold a string of them without missing one the stronger my attacks would become. On my opponents part hitting the notes blocked my attacks. The longer he or she kept up the string, the higher their defense. It became a race to see who messed up first. If I could get a near flawless run of notes and they suddenly missed a step, I could potentially one hit K.O. them. But if I dropped the string before them my attacks would be too weak to bypass his defenses.

The song switched up halfway through it’s normal course since this was a progressive battle. My red attacker icon changed to a blue shield just as the machine said I was on the defensive. My opponent was good, they hit the right notes and almost hit me with a counter attack on the change up but I countered the counter. Not many people knew about these small periods of vulnerability to get in a more powerful hit by transferring the stored defensive power to attack before it went to zero. The song got faster as the arrows moved to compensate.

“Level up!”

We would go back and forth like this as the notes came faster and faster. Soon hand movements would start coming in to add to the confusion. It wouldn’t stop until one of us lost.

“Level up!”

It was my turn to attack already? I must have zoned out a bit. So focused on moving my feet and throwing open palms forward that I hadn’t realized. I tuned out the cheering behind me, narrowing my eyes only on the game. We were both at about half health now.

“Attacker is on fire! Double down! Level Up!”

Was I the attacker? I looked at the corner quickly and saw I was the defender. That brief moment cost me as I missed a beat and my avatars fists dropped. I heard the collective sucking in of breath as the other avatar hit me with a flaming right hook followed by a left jab. I tried to bounce back but his stronger attacks tore through my blocks. In the space of a heartbeat my toon was wobbling in a dizzy animation.

“Finishing blow!”

I watched as a gauge popped up on screen and began filling up with a blue liquid as my opponent danced to fill it up. If he missed just one step I still had a chance. I would recover and go on the attack. I could almost see everyone behind me leaning forward in expectation. Holding their breath.

Finally the gauge filled to the top and the enemy avatar did a flying spin kick over and over into my avatars face until he kicked his head off.

“Victory! Challenger wins!

Everyone behind me went aww at my loss but then congratulated me on my skill before dispersing back to other parts of the arcade. That’s why I liked this town, not a lot of people knew me as the bad boy delinquent. If this had been Gorgan city, no one would have been cheering for me. Taking off the gloves and stepping off the mini dance floor I walked around the side to congratulate my opponent. He was a short guy, maybe around five feet tall give or take with distinct Asian features. Unusual to see foreigners around these parts. I extended my hand with a grin.

“Good game man.”

He looked at my hand and then at me but didn’t shake it. Simply shoving his hands into his pockets. I felt my eye twitch in anger at the snub but dropped my arm.

“So what’s your name? You aren’t from around here I can tell that much.”

“I am Yuki Kamishiro and you are Richard Noel are you not?”

“How do you know my name?”

He shrugged.

“That is my curse. Though some claim it is a gift. I am a kickback like yourself. I am in need of your assistance.”

“And how do you know I am a kickback or that I can even help you?”

Again a shrug.

“I told you. It is my gift. I am descended from Cassandra. The one cursed to see the future and yet never have her visions be believed. Thankfully I am not bound by the full curse. I can simply see the future if I wish to. Though sometimes it comes when I do not. Seeing the future is not as fun as it might sound. It was through one of these visions that I know of you and know that you can help me.”

“You could have at least shaken my hand.”

It was only a grumble under my breath but he still heard me.

“I do not touch people if I can help it. Doing so brings on visions of their future. And always visions of their death. Even gloves do not stop them, though they shorten the span of the visions.”

“Well then what do you want from me?”

He shook his head quickly.

“The time is not right to tell you. I will contact you again. I simply came today to introduce myself.

He turned to walk away, but only made it a few steps before he looked back at me.

“Oh, you will meet a girl later on tonight in trouble. One with blond hair and wearing a light blue sweater. You should help her.”

With that he turned and left the arcade. Well this had just got interesting.

“Interesting indeed. Now we have a bit of a conundrum don’t we? A prophesied meeting, perhaps a love interest for our strong armed hero? An enigmatic statement hinting at things to come. And a young man with the power to see the future. Who knows what mysteries lay dormant in his head. What knowledge of things to come he might reveal if we follow him.”

“So do we continue to follow Richard to his fateful meeting? Or do we follow this Yuki Kamishiro fellow?”
1121.title: Into the night...

11211.content:
Kamishiro huh? Strange guy no matter how you looked at it. I wonder what it would be like, having the ability to see the future whether you wanted to or not. Would make acing tests a snap. But being unable to touch people without seeing how they die. That was a real negative for me. Sometimes having the strength to lift up a car and able to make mini earthquakes was too much for me. Having to hold back your real strength could be a real pain.

I saw a pink heart necklace in a jewelry store window and decided to buy it. I wasn’t big on the girly stuff but Amy liked it. Chris had helped me patch things up, but I had to remember to keep her in mind if I wanted her to stay my girlfriend. He had said random gifts would always get me a lot of points with her. I was seriously in his debt. I don’t know where I would be now if he hadn’t knocked some sense into me.

I still remembered the day I had picked a fight with him back during my first year of high school. Little more then a snot faced delinquent thinking I was top dog because of my strength. Ruled the middle school and made a name for myself. Had my own little gang of henchmen. Running the streets and claiming the town as my own. He had come waltzing through town for whatever reason and I had taken an instant dislike to him. Cornered him in an abandoned parking lot with eight of my gang.

He had taken us all out. Even made me use all my power. But in the end he had put me on my backside. Then he had offered me a hand up with a grin. That was a good rumble. Though is this really the best use of your strength? Real strength doesn’t come from how many people you can get to fear you or how many people you can beat up. Names Chris. Chris Wees. What’s your’s? After that we had begun hanging out from time to time even though he was from the next city over. I wasn’t even sure when it happened exactly, I just realized I had woken up one day and I wasn’t interested in fighting as much anymore. More interested in getting my grades up and being a more respectable person. But that stigmata of being a bad boy still stuck.

If he was a kickback like me, Robin couldn’t tell. She didn’t feel any vibes coming from him. He was just that strong. Maybe not physically the strongest, but he had skill to make up for that lack. I had found myself talking to him about anything and everything, home life, girls, deep philosophical thoughts. He had a way of putting things in perspective or helping me figure it out on my own without making me feel dumb. A fact that made me like him even more.

As I turned the corner I saw a girl with blond hair and a light blue sweater sitting at a bus stop bench crying. I was half tempted to keep on walking. For all I knew Kamishiro’s words had been a lie meant to somehow trap me. But I would give him the benefit of the doubt for now. As I got closer I noticed she had no shoes on and her skirt was ripped up a bit. Her knee was also bleeding where it looked like she had tripped and fallen.

“So, What’s the matter girl? You lost or somethin’?”

She glanced at me through her tears before flinching slightly and trying to back away unobtrusively. I was used to this kind of reaction. Even though it could still tick me off sometimes I had gotten better at controlling myself and hiding my initial response to yell at them. With a sigh I hunched my shoulders and stuck my hands in my pockets while keeping a grin plastered on my face. I had found this took the edge off my threatening looks and made people more comfortable around me. Finally she slowly nodded her head.

“Yeah I’m lost. And I forgot my cell phone at home. Some guys chased me and I just ran. I lost my shoes someplace and I tripped while running. I finally lost them but I don’t know where I am.”

She looked to be about my age, so maybe sixteen or seventeen. She was kind of pretty too. Mentally I kicked myself for being such a softie when it came to women. I would probably help her anyways even if I hadn’t been told I should. I couldn’t just leave the poor girl out here all alone. Especially now that it was starting to drizzle.

“Do you live around here? If so I could walk you home. I know this area pretty well.”

She sniffed a few times but finally told me her address hesitantly. I silently shook my head. She was too trusting of a stranger. If I had been intent on harming her she would have been in real trouble. As it was I sat down next to her and pulled off my shoes and handed them to her.

“They might be a little big but at least it will cover your feet. Your street isn’t too far away. About a twenty minute walk. I’ve got a friend that lives over that way so I know the general area.”

She tried to protest but I shot her down gently. She took one last look at me before slipping her feet into my shoes. I pulled off my shirt as well and offered it to her as a makeshift umbrella. Again she tried to protest but I wouldn’t hear it.

“It’s not that cold out and I’m not bothered by it. I’m built to not get colds. You know the saying, stupid don’t catch colds.”

“You’re not stupid.”

“Yes I am. I know it. It’s just the way I was born.”

“Won’t your feet get cold and wet?”

“Probably. But better my feet get wet then your’s. You look like the type that catches a cold easily.”

“Well you are right kind of, I do catch colds more often then other people.”

“See?”

We started walking as she put my shirt over her head to keep the rain off. I could hear the clopping as my over large shoes smacked the cement. I decided to fill the silence with some conversation to keep her mind off her situation.

“What’s your name anyway?”

“I’m Chelsea Winters.”

“Richard Noel. Pleasure to meet you. So any particular reason you were out so late?”

“Not really.”

“Ah, I know that tone. Boy trouble I bet.”

“How’d you know?”

“I’m psychic. Actually been on the other side with some girl trouble of my own just recently. My friend helped me out of it. Want to tell me about it? Perhaps I can pass the favor on. You don’t know me and I don’t know you. Sometimes it’s easier to talk to a near stranger about this kind of stuff.”

“This might sound kind of pathetic, but there is this boy that confessed to me and I shot him down. But he is still my friend and acts like nothing has happened. I don’t want things to change between us, but my parents keep pushing me to get together with him. One of my girlfriends said she is going to make a move on him but I don’t want that either. We got into a bit of an argument tonight while he was over at my place and he kissed me out of the blue. I didn’t know what else to do so I ran out the door. I just kept running and ended up lost.”

“Sounds to me like a part of you wants to be his girlfriend. Otherwise you wouldn’t be so adverse to another girl taking him. I’m not an expert on relationships. My friend is better at this stuff then I am. But I don’t think it is wrong to want to just stay friends. I mean sure I would feel hurt if I confessed my feelings to someone and got rejected, but I wouldn’t see that as a reason to stop being friends with them either. If that was what she really wanted I would learn to accept that and move on. I mean guys and girls can have a relationship without dating.”

“But it sounds like you don’t want to move on. You want to keep things in stasis so you don’t have to make any decisions. I’m not saying that’s wrong, but I don’t think it is completely right either. It’s unfair both to you and to him. I can’t say why he kissed you either, but that sort of tells me that he still likes you and isn’t completely content with being just a friend.”

We walked along in silence for a while and the rain finally stopped. As we were turning into the residential area she finally spoke up again.

“Thanks for trying to help me. Oddly I feel better now. You’re right, I really need to think about what I want. I never thought that I was being unfair to him before. Despite what you say, you’re pretty smart. A dumb person wouldn’t have been able to talk like that.”

“Thanks. But it doesn’t take brains to have a bit of common sense and just speak your mind. But I will take your compliment with grace.”

After another five or six minutes we came to her house and she slipped my shoes off, handing them back to me. While I put my wet shirt back on and snuggled my feet back into the sneakers she asked if I wanted to come in and dry off. I declined the offer and turned away. Time I got back home anyway. She gave me one last wave as I opened the gate and started walking back down the street towards the bus stop.
11211.title: The fated meeting...

112112.content:
“Wake up! Wake up! Hey! Hey! Mom said to wake up! Wake up big brother!”

I grumbled a bit but finally opened my eyes, swatting at my little sister half heartedly. She jumped away laughing but continued to dance around the room saying wake up in a sing-song voice.

“All right already I’m up! Now go away!”

“Nuh-uh! You’re still in bed!”

I threw a pillow at her as I sat up, catching her square in the face.”

“There you happy? I’m sitting up, now go away.”

She threw the pillow back, which I caught one handed as she giggled and left the room. I had to wonder what went through her ten year old mind sometimes. But now that I was sitting up, might as well keep moving and stand.

I idly scratched my chest as I began putting on my black school uniform. Who had thought making kids go to school six days a week was a good idea anyway? I knew other places only went five. Leave the weekends to us at least. I noticed the pant legs seemed a bit short. Had I put on another small growth spurt? That was what, the third one this year? I’d have to see if mom could let out the seams. My alarm clock went off as I finished dressing and I hit the snooze button. Couldn’t they have let me sleep those five extra minutes? Ah well, what’s done is done as Chris would say.

I made my way to the kitchen where the smell of bacon and eggs filled the room. Pouring myself a glass of orange juice and snagging a slice of toast sitting out on the counter. I tried to get away with just that but my mother pointed at the table with her spatula, her “don’t give me no lip” look on her face. I sighed and sat down moments before she put a plate in front of me loaded up with food. Gina came in and plopped down into a chair across from me waiting for her own food, kicking her feet back and forth happily.

“Oh Richard, your friend Chris is coming over today to help you study right?”

“Yeah what of it?”

“You think he will be staying for dinner?”

“Yeah probably. He usually does.”

“Then I’ll make sure to set out an extra plate for him.”

“Chris is coming over today! Sweet!”

“Why are you getting excited runt? He’s not coming to see you. And I can tell you now he isn’t interested in underdeveloped girls seven years younger than him.”

“Hmph! Shows what you know! I have all the guys at school falling all over me! I’m a ripe fruit that has yet to blossom.”

“Better check again, I think you’ve already gone rotten if you’re talking like that. Quit trying to act grown up and using big people words.”

“Mom! Richards being mean to me!”

“Quit being mean to your sister.”

“I’m not being mean. There’s a whole lot more I could say if I really wanted to be mean.”

“He says he isn’t being mean to you.”

I grinned across the table at my sister who stuck her tongue out at me. Our mother hadn’t even turned around or sounded interested at all in our back and forth. This was a normal morning and her replies were almost absentminded and automatic. She sat a plate of extra bacon on the table between us so we could both pick at it before wiping her hands and sitting down at the table as well. She looked at me a moment as if studying me intently.

“What?”

“I was just thinking. Becoming friends with Chris has done you a world of good. You seem more
settled. Happier. He’s been a good influence on you.”

“You’re just imagining things. I’m the same person I always was.”

“No you’re not. You were a mean big brother before. Scary. Now you aren’t so scary.”

“I’m still mean and scary.”

“Yeah but not to me anymore. Only to other people.”

I lowered my head and continued to eat. I felt uncomfortable having them say those kinds of things to me. I knew I had changed. They didn’t need to point it out to me. It felt weird. My cell phone rang as I was finishing up breakfast. When I checked the number it came up unknown.

“Hello?”

“We have your sister. If you want her back then you have to do a small job for us. I know you possess great strength. Almost god like strength. If you let anyone know about this we will kill her. Come to Laurel Street in Medusa City right now. You will get your next set of instructions there.”

I moved away from my mother and sister to talk in a lowered voice without being overheard.

“Who are you and how do I know you aren’t bluffing?”

“We are crusaders. We have been given the mission of purging this city of its corruption. And eventually the world. We are the Inquisition. As for how to prove we are not lying, well check your phone in a moment. You have one hour.”

The voice that sounded like someone had used a synthesizer hung up. I stared at it for a moment, dreading what might happen. It vibrated to say I got a text from an unknown caller. I hit the receive button hesitantly. A picture of Robin tied up to a chair and gagged met my eyes. Under it the words tick, tock; tick, tock.

I headed for the door while shoving the phone back into my pocket.

“Off to school already?”

“Uh yeah. I want to get some extra studying at the library in.”

“Ok be safe then.”

I was already running towards the bus station before the door finished closing. Halfway there my phone rang again. A quick glance told me it was another unknown number. Angrily I hit the talk button and put it to my ear.

“I swear to god if you hurt her I am going to rip your lungs out through your throat and feed it back to you!”

“Good morning to you too. Though I’m not your enemy. I’m simply someone wishing to help. I already have someone saving your sister.”

“And I suppose you want something from me as well in exchange for her safe return?”

“Nope. All I want is for you to head to the rendezvous point and find out what they want you to do. Then tell me when I call you back. After that head over to Peach Street and pick her up from Yuki.”

“Now that I know where she is, what makes you think I’ll even go to Laurel Street?”

“Because I know. You could say you have already gone there.”

“You got that future seeing ability like Yuki?”

“Something like that. But you strike me as the kind of man that likes to repay a debt as soon as possible.”

“How do I know you aren’t lying?”

“You don’t.”

The bus stop came into view just as the inter city bus was pulling up.

“Fine! But you better not be lying to me.”

Again the click as the mysterious person hung up the phone. He at least had offered me a name I knew and a place to find Robin. It made me inclined to trust him even though I had no clue who he was.. Jumping onto the bus I dropped a few coins in the machine for my toll and sat in the back, wishing the twenty minute ride to Medusa City was already over.

“Oh now this is a bit of excitement in the morning. Not one but two mysterious phone calls. Just wait until you see what happens next! Oh yeah, sorry. I kind of cheated and looked into the future a bit. I had to find out what was going on. I know, I know. I promised you I wouldn’t cheat like that. That I would be with you every step of the way, but this is just so juicy!”

“Wait, what? I didn’t make any promise like that? Are you sure? Hold on let me check back through time a moment.”

…….

…….

……

“Well I’ll be colored a purple people eater! I was thinking of another timeline entirely. One of the many possibilities that exist out there. Simply not the possibility we are in right now. Good at least now I don’t feel so bad… Oh who am I kidding? I didn’t feel bad about it to begin with!”

“What’s that? What color is a colored purple people eater? What kind of silly question is that? They are pink of course! Jeez, and you humans think you are so smart! I bet you don’t even know what a green backed hornbuckler looks like either! Well no matter. I still have a fondness for you in my heart. You are my creation after all."
112112.title: Richard is the man!

1121121.content:
“Your mission is simple. We simply require you to go to the police station. Around the back is a fenced in area with a lock. Simple enough for someone like you to break. Inside this locked fence is a triple reinforced steel case. There is a door on this case. Your mission is to break into that case. That is all. How you get inside is up to you. But once you have broken in you may leave. Others will come around later and finish the job. You have one hour to complete this mission. When you are done await my next call on Follier Road. If you fail you know what happens.”

The mysterious man hung up the phone and I started heading for the police station. It was on the way to Peach Street anyway so it wasn’t too bad. About two minutes later the phone rang again and I answered it.

“Well what was the mission?”

I told him while jogging down the sidewalk, wondering if one or both of these mysterious people was watching me.

“Thanks for the info. You helped save a lot of lives today. Don’t worry about doing that job. Your sister should be seeing daylight right about now anyway. If everything went according to plan she should be around Peach and First by the time you get there. Have a good life, this will probably be the last you hear from me.”

The phone went silent as he hung up on me. I saw the sign for Peach right in front of me just as a loud boom filled the air. The ground shook and I spread my legs to keep from falling over. A pillar of flame rose like a pennant into the air right around where I remember the old church stood. Seconds later I felt a blast of hot air from the shockwave and smelled the smoke.

Racing around the corner I saw Chris standing over a girl looking up at the tower of fire like he was ready to wrestle it bare handed. As I got closer and the girl began to get to her feet I recognized her as the one from last night. Chris turned to look at me and seemed surprised that I was there. Then again, I did live an entire city away and go to a different school. The girl was just as surprised, pointing at me when she saw my face, her jaw dropping a bit.

“You! You’re the guy from last night! Richard Noel right?”

“Aye. And you’re Chelsea Winters.”

“Wait, you two know each other?”

“Yeah he walked me home last night after… after dinner.”

“I didn’t know that trouble you were telling me about was Chris! If I had I would have given you better advice.”

“Like what you oversized muscle factory?”

“Like she should stay as far away from you as possible. That you are nothing but trouble.”

I grinned as I shook his hand and looked up at the flames of the building just out of sight. They were beginning to spread to some of the nearby houses and I could hear fire trucks in the distance.

“So what brings you out this way you big idiot?”

I glanced over at Chelsea before pulling him off to the side and whispering.

“My sister. Someone kidnapped her and tried to use her to force me to do a job.”

“Ah must have been the Inquisition. I heard they are becoming really active around these parts. Had your sister holed up under the church. No worries me and a fellow named Yuki got her out before it turned into that giant bonfire you see before you.”

“You mean she was in there!”

“Aye. Yuki is escorting her away right now, heading towards First street last I saw. If you hurry you can still catch them. Careful though, he has a gun. Don’t want you getting shot on me now. You might be an idiot but you’re still my friend.”

“Thanks mate. I owe you big time for this. I don’t know how you knew what was going down or how you pulled it off and I don’t want to know. But you saved my sister so that makes anything you did A-Ok in my book.”

“No worries. And if I don’t see you again soon, keep safe and don’t die.”

“Back at you bro.”

I began running off towards Peach and First, assured that I would find my sister safe and sound. I made it a few blocks before his words actually sunk in completely. I stopped running and looked behind me. He was long out of sight of course, but I felt like I could still see his ghost image. That had been a long term goodbye. Not a “I’ll see you later today” type. What was he planning? What was he going to do? And was he expecting to die? I was torn. I wanted to see my sister and make sure she was safe, but I also didn’t want to let Chris go off to do whatever he was going to do alone. I owed him. He had saved my bacon more times than I could count. The least I could do was watch his back.

Finally I turned and continued to run. He could take care of himself. He wouldn’t die that easily. I wouldn’t forgive him if he died that easily. Right now my sister was more important.

I spied the back of Yuki’s head as I came up on the intersection, standing next to the bakery. There was no one else around, which seemed a bit strange. With the recent explosion and this being a busier part of town I would have thought the roads would be crawling with people. At least a random car or two.

Suddenly Yuki turned around pointing a gun at me, his hands shaking so much I thought they might vibrate right off his body. When he saw it was me he let out a sigh and dropped his arm. Robin turned just as I was almost on them, saw me and ran into my arms. I returned her embrace quickly, telling her it was all right.

“So you came like he said you would.”

“He? He who?”

“The guy that convinced me to fly halfway around the world. He calls himself Mr. Nobody.”

“Slightly deep voice? A bit gravely, like his throat was messed up?”

“That’s him. How’d you know?”

“He called me this morning and told me to come here.”

“I don’t know what his full game is since I can’t see his future, but I could use the help.”

“What are you talking about? He didn’t say anything about helping you.”

“Yeah? Well I doubt he planned on me being surrounded either. Or perhaps he did and that’s why he sent you here.”

“Surrounded?”

“Yeah check the rooftops and watch the windows of the buildings. I’ve looked into the future as far as I can and I’ve seen around twenty guys in all. But every future I saw ended up with me and the girl dead.”

“Why haven’t they opened fire yet then?”

“I don’t know. I can only see what’s going to happen, not the reasons for things.”

“What about now? You said in the futures you saw both of you died. Does that change now that I am here?”

I watched his eyes take on a slightly blank expression as his breathing suddenly slowed down. As his body stiffened his eyes rolled up into his head and began to twitch around rapidly. I heard him begin to mumble and strained my ears to catch the words.

“Come on. Come on. One more minute farther. Show me. No. No. No. No good. Not that one. Hurry.”

Blood began to run from his nose as his head shook slightly. Finally he seemed to pop out of whatever trance he was in, his body giving one final convulsion before he wiped the blood away and looked at me.

“I’m sorry. I couldn’t see past my normal five minutes no matter how hard I tried. Most of the futures you died too and the ones where we didn’t I can’t say what happens after.”

“I’ll take it. Tell me what to do. Read the future on the fly if you can. We will go down one of the routes you saw where we didn’t die and just change things on the move. If we end up dead then so be it. But at least we won’t just sit here waiting to be slaughtered.”

“You’ll never figure out anything if you sit around doing nothing huh?”

“What’s that?”

“It’s something Mr. Nobody told me. When I was too scared to leave my house back in Japan. Too afraid of my power. He stood there with his hand out, looking down on me like some god from heaven. He said, what do you wish to accomplish? Are you content to hide away from the world doing nothing? Wasting away into oblivion? You have a gift. A gift not many other people have. With it you can do a great deal of good if you so choose. Whether your power really is a gift or a curse is up to you to decide. But how can you decide if you don’t use it? You will never figure out anything if you sit around doing nothing.”

“I took his hand, afraid to see what visions would come. Afraid to see how he would die. But nothing came. It was the first time I had seen nothing at all when I touched another person. When I asked him how that was possible he grinned and said that he was a man that was part and yet apart from the flow of time. That I could not see his future because his future had not yet been decided. And now that I am here I have met someone else just like that, who is part and yet apart from the flow of time that I cannot see the future of.”

“Interesting. I’d like to meet them both. But in order to do that we need to move. Tell me what to do and where to go. I’ll follow your lead.”

“But what if I end up killing us?”

“Then I’ll never forgive you for it. Now tell me.”

He clenched his fists and looked at the ground for a moment before sucking in a deep breath.

“Into the bakery.”

I grabbed Robin and opened the bakery door.
1121121.title: Follow that bus!

11211211.content:
“Welcome! What can I get for you today?”

“Out the back.”

I pushed past the backer, ignoring his words. When he turned to say something to me I saw Yuki chop him on the back of the neck, making him crumple to the ground. The back of the shop was full of the craft of bread making. Ovens, flour, dough, salt, utensils of all shapes and sizes. There was a woman making bread at one of the tables and she looked up in surprise.

“What are you doing back here?”

“Ignore her. Go to the back door and count to twenty before opening it. As soon as you do there will be a man standing with his back to you on your left. Take him out and go that way to the end of the alley.”

I ran over to the back door and began counting. When the woman lifted a rolling pin and started to get angry Yuki pointed his gun at her, shutting her up immediately.

“We will be gone in a moment ma’am. Just be quiet and go about your day. We mean you no harm.”

“Please don’t hurt me.”

“I said I wouldn’t. Just forget you saw us.”

As soon as I got to twenty in my head I twisted the knob and pushed on the door. The man was there to the left just like he had said. I brought my arm around and smashed him into the wall from behind, making him drop to the ground unconscious. It was only a few quick steps to the alley mouth after that where I plastered myself against the wall.

“Wait until my signal. When I say go, run across the street into the opposite alley. You have five seconds to do it. Think you can manage?”

“Easy.”

I grabbed Robin around the waist with one arm and Yuki around the waist with the other. I saw his eyes had the glassy look I had seen before. Though he wasn’t as stiff as a board this time. When he told me to go I lifted them both up and dashed for all I was worth for the designated spot. I was already setting them down after only three seconds.

Continuing to follow Yuki’s directions we went in and out of buildings, some occupied some not. Ending up on rooftops and making jumps to other buildings like action heroes. Our route wasn’t without danger of course. I had to knock four more people out and Yuki shot one in the arm when he jumped out a window at us. He was looking a bit green in the face but otherwise was holding up well.

“Ok. We’re safe. I don’t see anyone following us anymore.”

I let out a sigh of relief as Yuki slid to the ground and leaned his head against the side of the building behind us. I glanced up and saw we were standing between the jailhouse and the police station and I began to grin stupidly. Seems I ended up here anyway.

“So Yuki. Care to tell me exactly what’s going on? You said yesterday the time wasn’t right, well if this time isn’t right I don’t know what is.”

“War. That’s what it boils down to. There’s this group called the Inquisition. They consider themselves some sort of holy crusaders. They think this world needs to be reformed. Humans are a disease to them. Something that has infected this world and needs to be purged. They believe they have been given a divine mission by god to cleanse everything. The only ones worthy of living are the “evolved” humans. Kickbacks like us. Though only if we share their ideals. If we don’t want to join them we are considered “infected” by the lower humans.”

“Though from what I know they don’t want all humans to die. Only most of them. They hunt down those with latent kickback powers, intent on activating them or at the least breeding them into existence. They think if two kickbacks with different powers have a child that child can obtain both abilities. There is proof of this, since their leader has two abilities that Mr. Nobody knows of. The rest of humanity that they spare will become little more than slaves.”

“And why exactly are they starting their fight here of all places? I mean Medusa City might be big, but it’s not exactly the center of things.”

“From what I know it is because of a prophesy of some sort. I think they have someone on their side with the ability to see the future like I can. But I think theirs is stronger than mine. This area is a place where a large number of kickbacks tend to gather for some reason. Though I don’t know why.”

“So what? You are running around playing at a superhero all by yourself?”

“Hardly. Mr. Nobody is pulling together everyone and anyone he can get and trust to fight them. Police, kickbacks, regular people. Not everyone can know of course, and we have to be careful who we trust even among those we tell. People just aren’t ready to accept those like us. Even among the non kickbacks helping us we are still held at arms length. They fear our power, fear we will switch to the other side. That’s why we need to be careful what we say. There are corrupt cops that the enemy is using as well.”

“There are kickbacks in the ranks of the cops?”

“Nope. They are hypocrites. Claiming to detest regular humans yet still working with and using them. Don’t ask me to figure out the minds of these people. All I know is they have started a war and they won’t stop if we ask them nicely with sugar on top.”

“So that’s this Mr. Nobodies game huh? He wants me to join you.”

“Not at all. He gave me no such instructions to try and recruit you.”

“Then why didn’t you tell me all of this yesterday?”

“Because he said it had to happen this way. If your sister hadn’t been captured they would not contact you. Then he wouldn’t have known what they were planning.”

“This Mr. Nobody seems like a bit of an A******. Putting people in danger like that for his own selfish reasons.”

“I’ve seen humanity. That’s all they are is selfish. Everyone is like that in some way shape or form. Manipulating and using others to get what they want. He might be a bit of an A****** like you say, but there is no questioning that he is effective.”

His body went ridged for a moment and I somehow knew he was having another vision. As his shoulders slumped he lifted the pistol in his hand and pointed it at me.

“Don’t move.”

He fired a shot and I flinched instinctively. I could still feel the wind as the bullet whizzed past my ear. I turned quickly to see someone falling to the ground, blood flying out of the back of his head. The machine gun he was holding dropping from his fingers.

“I killed him. I killed him! I didn’t mean to, I just… killed him. There was no other way. You got to believe me! I didn’t see another way! But I knew where to aim.”

Yuki’s eyes were wide with shock as he stared down at the weapon in his hand. He looked up at me as if looking for confirmation that he had done the right thing. As if he could find the answers in my face.

“You did good. If you hadn’t killed him he would have killed us right? And you can’t do anything to stop these Inquisition people if you are dead right?”

“Yeah… Yeah. You’re right. It’s just… that was the first time I killed anyone. It seems worse because it was the first time I used my visions to do it as well. People die all the time right? And this is a war right? I mean people die in wars so this is only natural right?”

“Right. Now pick yourself up and get moving. We can’t sit here all day. Did your Mr. Nobody tell you where to go once you were safe?”

“Yeah. Yeah he did. There is a safe house. He told me to go there and lay low.”

“Then let’s move it. I’d feel better if we weren’t out in the open. I can take care of myself but I don’t want my sister in any more danger if I can help it. I don’t know about joining your little resistance or anything but right now these guys are trying to kill me and you aren’t. So I’ll stick with you for now until I get a better idea of just what the hell is going on.”

“Yeah. Yeah. That’s a good plan. Follow me.”

Yuki still seemed to be in a bit of shock but was slowly snapping himself out of it. He headed off towards the man he had shot and past him quickly. Turning and walking down the road at a speed walk. On my way past I picked up the machine gun and the extra clip that I spied at the mans waist, cocking back the handle to make sure it was loaded as I followed behind my sister. I had no clue how to use it of course, but I was sure I would learn quickly. Just point and pull the trigger, it couldn’t be that hard.

“I’m liking this Richard fellow. Got a bit of brains in him. More than I can say about Zeulecus, the one who gave him that strength of his. I think your ancient Greeks called him Zeus. Shows how smart they were if they thought that idiot son of mine was wise. Who do you think taught the cavemen how to chose a woman? Yep Zeulecus. Just bash them over the head and drag them to a corner of the cave. Bet he hurt his head coming up with that idea too. I really should go check on him after this. I left him happily fighting the undead armies over on another world I created. Haven’t heard from him in the last hundred years or so. Wonder if he is bored yet.”

“Well enough of my musings. What do you want to do? Keep following our muscular man here or listen in on the mind of our shocked seer? I mean really, getting so worked up about killing someone. It’s not that hard and it’s nothing to get upset over. Well to each his own. It’s why I created you humans after all, to have free will and such varied personalities.”
11211211.title: With Richard in the bakery

112112111.content:
“Richard. Don’t turn around no matter what, just follow my directions. When I say now, dodge to the right. Same with you Mrs. Robin.”

“We got someone on our tail I take it? Someone with abilities?”

“Yes. And if you look back you will trip and fall.”

I nodded my head slightly as I continued to run next to Yuki and my sister. I didn’t know what it was he saw but he had proven himself to me already. I would trust him with my life, even if anything he said might not make much sense to me.

“Now!”

I sidestepped to the right while running seconds before a line of what looked like black lightning shot forward and struck the air to my left. It would have hit me square in the head if I hadn’t moved. I wanted to turn around to see who my opponent was but Yuki had said not to. I had to resist the urge.

“Richard, dodge to the left and Robin to the right in five… four… three… two… one!”

We split apart just as another bolt cracked the air between us. It was close enough to my arm to not only raise the hairs but also leave a lingering phantom of pain. I had a feeling if I got hit directly by one of these bolts I would either die or be withering on the ground in agony.

The three of us continued to dodge the black whips being sent our way as we ran. Not once looking back. After only a few moments a guy that was almost as big as I was came charging like a bull down the street towards us. He was wearing a pink frilly dress and had his hair done up in twin pigtails. The eyeliner and lipstick making his already manly face and square jaw look even manlier.

“Yo! Cindy! What’s up girl! What are you doing here?”

“Ma petite peche! I was told to come here by Nobody. Told you might have a bit of a pest problem.”

“I do. As you can see it’s a cockroach that just won’t leave us alone. Mind stomping it out for me?”

“For you ma peche anything! I’ll hug him and squeeze him and rip his cute little head off just for you!”

His voice was a bit high and sweet up until the moment he said he would rip the guys head off. Then it became deep and dark like he had suddenly become possessed by a demon. Yuki nodded his thanks and mimed a high five while passing at a run, their hands never once coming close to touching. We left the big man behind to take care of our pursuer while Yuki led us farther away.

“Who was that guy?”

“That was Cindy and she is a woman.”

“No way! He had a six o’clock shadow! His arms were bigger then mine!”

“It’s true. And don’t let her hear you call her a him. She is very sensitive about her looks.”

I left it at that but privately I still though she was ugly as sin. Looking like she could scare the red out of the devil himself. Having taken one too many hits with the ugly bat. But if she was willing to fight on our side I wouldn’t complain. Though I would still like to know who had been shooting at us.

We finally made it to the hideout, a large three story house smack dab on the outskirts of the residential area. This was a case of hiding in plain sight. There were at least four or five house that looked exactly like this one within a one block radius. Even right down to the yellow coloring.

Yuki led us inside quickly, letting out a sigh of relief before sitting on the stairs. Robin was bent over panting heavily as well, at the limit of her endurance. It wasn’t that we had run all that fast, but she wasn’t used to this kind of distance running. Built more for shopping and doing her normal job of being a secretary. Yuki began to laugh a bit hysterically but I didn’t know what was so funny. Perhaps the stress had just made him crack.

A tall distinguished man standing about six feet tall walked out of the back rooms, his cane tapping the floor to herald his presence. He had a white eye patch over his left eye and his right was a piercingly blue orb. It seemed to see deep into my soul as he came towards me. His beard was clean cut and squared off, revealing the edge of a cut that had healed on his chin and a faint line across his throat. His chest seemed to naturally puff out as he walked and his arms were well muscled and defined. I could instantly tell he was a brick powerhouse and could probably match me strength for strength easily.

“Mr. Nobody I take it?”

He gave a slight nod to me at my question, both for confirmation and greeting. Without warning I swung my fist at his face. He had made me jump through so many hoops and used me for his own ends I just had to punch him.

I didn’t even see him move. One moment he was in front of me, the next my fist was hitting empty air and he had a thin sword laying against my throat. I slowly opened my fist and held up my left hand in surrender. Almost nonchalantly he pulled the sword away and slid it back into his cane.

“I hope your anger is spent now. I’m sure you must be ticked at me and that’s understandable. But like it or not things had to happen the way they did. Even if you can’t understand the reasons why. I’d prefer not to get violent if we can at all help it. We might not be allies or friends, but we are all on the same side at the least.”

“Yeah fine. But next time you put my sister in danger like that I won’t stop until you kill me.”

“I would hope there not be a next time. I am trying very hard to prevent such a thing. Yuki. I’ve got another job for you if you are willing. An easy one that won’t involve much danger.

“Is that why you are here?”

“One of the reasons.”

“Sure, what’s the job?”

“I want you to go back up Willis. He’s in room 404 of the Hilington hotel. The one a block away from City Hall. No need to rush, he won’t need you for another three hours and no one will bother you on your way over.”

Kamishiro nodded his head a moment before waving and leaving the house again. Mr. Nobody shook his head while he watch the boy go.

“He never was one to put things off. Even though I told him there was no rush. But he seems a bit different now. I guess throwing him into that situation on First street was the right call.”

“Wait you knew about the ambush!”

“Of course.”

“And you still sent him into it with my sister!”

“It was the one of the only surefire ways of making his power grow with little risk. Besides I had already planned to send you after them. I knew the three of you could escape.”

“I really want to punch you right now. We are not some sort of chess piece you can move around as you wish!”

“Of course you are. In war there are generals and there are soldiers. Everyone can’t be a general, the same as everyone can’t be just a simple soldier. It is up to the generals to move the pieces most effectively to capture the opposition with minimal danger and losses to his side. Sometimes pieces have to be put in danger and risks taken to gain the advantage.”

With a growl I threw another punch at his face. This time he didn’t even move. My fist connected solidly with the side of his head. It was like punching a steel wall. His head didn’t even move an inch but my knuckles were on fire. When I pulled my hand away I saw the skin along one of them had busted open to reveal the bone.

“Feel better now? If so can we move on?”

He pulled out a small jar of cream and motioned for me to give him my hand and I did so reluctantly. He pulled the cap off and spread a bit of the cream on my wounds. Almost instantly my flesh closed up and my hand was as good as new. The salve had even taken away the pain. I looked at it in surprise before looking up at him.

“Just who are you?”

“I’m Nobody. Mr. Nobody. Nothing more and nothing less.”

“And what do you want from me?”

“Nothing. You already gave me the information I needed and you got your sister back. I would like you to join our cause of course, but I won’t ask it of you. All our members have joined of their own free will. Only a few of them have I directly asked. Most ask us to join instead. You are free to go if you wish, or stay and we will shelter and hide you and your family without any obligations. Today is the start of a war. This town and the adjoining one will not be safe soon. We already have over three dozen families of members and non members under our care.”

“Why go that far? Especially for people who won’t fight?”

“Because we are all human. Fight or don’t fight. We all still deserve to live. Those with power have an obligation to protect those without it. If I were to throw out everyone who was unwilling to fight, or unable to because they were weak, or old, or children, how are we any better then the Inquisition? We are named the Knights. That means more than just a name to me. Knights are defenders of the people. Swords and shields for the helpless. Beacons of hope and a light for the oppressed. We are everything the Inquisition is not.”

He walked past me and started up the stairs, his cane like a drumbeat on the steps.

“There is food in the kitchen if you are hungry. If you can wait a bit the cooks will have something ready for lunch.”

He only took two more steps before I called after him.

“Hey Mr. Nobody!”

He stopped at looked at me.

“Yes?”

“I really don’t like you.”

“I get that a lot.”

“But putting that aside, you need a strongman?”

“I’m sure I could find use for one.”

I grinned as he turned and continued up the steps.

“Hey look over there! Another one of those rifts! Or is this the first one we’ve seen? I forget. I think it is the second. No, no. definitely the first on Richards line. Last one was on Yuki’s I think. It’s your fault for not being able to see in the fourth dimension!”
112112111.title: Muscle man

choices: I'm sorry... I do love you. Can we go on please?
1121121111.content:
This really wasn’t all that bad. I needed to figure out a way to get my mom and sister to come over here for a bit without alarming them too much, but I had already seen how this city was starting to go to pot. Mr. Nobody and the rest of these Knights were doing a decent job of holding things together, and the other families under their protection seemed happy. Almost normal in their everyday lives. Treating this a bit like a vacation while at the same time knowing the seriousness of the situation. Those that couldn’t fight or do anything directly beneficial to the cause helped how they could. Such as cooking and cleaning. When I had asked around unobtrusively I found they did it of their own free will, no one was expected to pay for their keep as it were.

In fact these Knights were like one big messed up family. Some of them had powers, some of them didn’t. There was bickering and a bit of distrust but also a sense that even if two people hated each other they would have each others backs. Robin was already starting to integrate herself with these people, well I suppose I should think of them as my people since I was a Knight now too.

I leaned back in my chair after finishing off some of the best spaghetti I had ever tasted. It had been a long time since I had been able to eat as much as I wanted until my stomach felt like it would explode. There were four others around the table aside from me and Robin. I didn’t know them all that well or what their powers were but they seemed to be a pretty tight knit group the way they bantered with each other.

Mr. Nobody walked in, his eyes locking on our group a moment before heading in our direction. The other four saw him and gave a slight wave but didn’t bother coming to attention like I had seen a few others do.

“Ah Jean! I finally found you.”

“Yeah right. I bet you knew where to look from the get go.”

Mr. Nobody’s lip curled up slightly. “Perhaps.”

“So what do you want boss? Got a job for us?”

“I do indeed. One I think is suited to your teams unique skill set. I got word that the Inquisitions leader is going to go out recruiting. I’ll be leaving to try and stop him. But this does open up an opportunity for us. My sources say they are having a celebration tonight and will all be gathered in one place. I want you and your team to go party crash. Force them to relocate and set them back a bit. They have prisoners they are using as breeding stock being held there as well. If we can put them on the run, there is a chance to save many of them. Perhaps even capture a few for information.”

“Sounds easy enough. I take it you are going to leave Myste in charge while you are gone?”

“With you as second if you don’t mind.”

“An honor.”

I looked at Mr. Nobody a moment narrowing my eyes in speculation before speaking up.

“These are the people that kidnapped Robin right?”

“Yes.”

“Mind if I go too then? I want to get a bit of payback.”

“Up to Jean here. This is his mission now.”

“I don’t mind. I can get a chance to see what the rookie can do.”

Mr. Nobody nodded and walked away, leaving the six of us still sitting at the table. Jean wasn’t a big man like me but he had muscles. Not the gross bulging muscles of a bodybuilder that did nothing but lift weights all day. His was the muscles of a hard working man. And his slightly weather worn face showed it. He was probably pushing forty but his hair was already starting to turn grey. I found it a bit fascinating though that his hair wasn’t one color like most peoples, it was three shades that I could see. Black, brown and red intermingled with the white, giving him a very odd first impression.

“Like the hair?”

“What?”

“My hair. You were staring at it so intently. You like it?”

“Well I just thought it looked a bit strange.”

“Yeah I get that a lot. It comes from using my ability. I’ve just grown used to it so it don’t bother me anymore. So rookie, what is your power anyway? Or don’t you have one? It’s fine if you don’t I’m not like some of the others that got a problem with it. In fact Mac here aint got a lick of it but we haven’t booted him from the team for that yet.”

One of the guys to the left with black hair and glasses raised two fingers in greeting before going back to sipping his coffee.

“Strength. Insane strength.”

“Cool. Can’t wait to see it in action. Joker over here is an illusionist.”

“Don’t call me Joker! My name is Johnathan!”

“Right, right. Sorry I forgot.”

“You did not! You did it on purpose!”

“Just a slip of the tongue.”

“Joker” was a flame haired boy who couldn’t be more than thirteen or fourteen. Scrawny and gangly, he hadn’t grown completely into his body yet. His freckled face turned beat red until it almost matched his hair before he folded his arms and looked away.

“Anyways Jok…. Johnathan as I said is an illusionist and Mary over there is… well its kind of hard to explain what Mary is exactly. Her power isn’t exactly like ours.”

“What do you mean?”

“He means my power doesn’t fit into a single category like the rest of yours does.”

I looked over at Mary sitting next to me. She too was a surprise. When I had first seen her I had thought she was a grade schooler. A misconception she quickly dismissed when she lit up a cigarette and told me she was twenty three. She had the body and looks of an eight year old, barely topping four feet tall with big childlike eyes. Her pure white hair was long and curly, almost dragging the floor. Her green eyes seemed to be able to look into your very soul when she stared at you.

“My power comes from a Nine tailed fox spirit. So I do a bit of illusion and a bit of trickery but mostly I am energy. That’s the best way to describe it.”

“Energy?”

“You’ll see later.”

I looked back at Jean, raising my eyebrow in curiosity.

“So what’s your power?”

“Metal. I can bend metal at will. Iron, copper, refined, raw. If it’s a metal from the periodic table I can manipulate it with my bare hands and my will. Melting, smelting and reforming it within the space of a few seconds. I’m a descendant of Hephaestus, the Greek god of the forge. As such my body is my forge. My breath my bellows, and my will the fire.”

He picked up his fork and held it up for me to see. He sucked in his breath, letting it out slowly. As I watched the fork melted as if by an incredible heat, reforming into a tiny silver colored rose. He passed it across the table for me to inspect. Upon examination I could see it was really a rose and not just an illusion over a fork.

“Already refined metals are easier to control, most of the impurities have already been pulled out of it. When I pull raw stuff from the ground it takes a bit longer because I have to refine it myself. It was a great skill when I worked in the steel mills before they shut down. And like all abilities, it comes down to stamina. The bigger and stronger the thing I make, the more stamina it takes. It’s a good balancer, makes you invested in working out if you want to make your power stronger.”

Jean pushed his chair back and stood up, looking around the table at each of us.

“Well I’m going to go see what information I can get out of Mr. Nobody about the lay of the land for this mission. Also talk to Sara and the other seers, see if they can tell me anything.”

Everyone waved farewell with a good natured insult chasing him out of the room. Once he was gone Mary looked at me with an grin plastered on her face.

“Don’t let him fool you. He may act all meek and mild like that but he is a real monster. Probably the strongest of us after Mr. Nobody and Myste. He has the nickname The Diamond Knight for a reason.”

Staring off at the door where Jean had left I began to wonder just what I was going to see later on today. Just what had I gotten myself into? Robin put her hand on top of mine and I absently covered it with my right. She was telling me to be careful without saying anything. A fact I already knew but it was good to be reminded of it by her. I loved her, but I knew it would never work out. So I would hide my feelings and continue on like normal. We were and could only be brother and sister.

“Oh an epic battle! A showdown of kickback versus kickback! Five against an untold number! This is so exhilarating! Exciting! Exhausting!”

“Wait no, not exhausting. Hmm, what’s another good “ex” word to put in there? Ah! I know! Explosive!”

…..

“You try narrating what is going on to a mortal so their mind can comprehend it! Do you think it is easy filtering out all the random thoughts and images for you? Adapting the thoughts into a more pleasing format? Making the unintelligible emotions they are feeling into thoughts you can understand? And what thanks do I get? What thanks have you given me so far? Nothing! You don’t appreciate me! I work so hard for you and you just take it for granted! Why don’t you love me! All I want is your love!”
1121121111.title: What's on your mind Richard?

11211211111.content:
“So how exactly are we going to do this? Just run in and smash things up?”

“Spoken like a true strongman. But no. Running headlong into the place is stupid. Mr. Nobody said the place would probably have some defenses. I guess their leader who calls himself Mr. Ghost is a lot like Mr. Nobody. From the sounds of it the two of them have a long history together. Always clashing in their views. He didn’t say anything directly, but that was the sense I got. Lets just walk up nice and easy. Take things as they come.”

“So we wing it just like we usually do.”

“Yep.”

“How is that any different than my plan?”

“We walk into it instead of run.”

“I feel so much more confident now.”

“Ha! Welcome to the Knights rookie. Where we have no clue what we are doing but we pretend we do.”
