Jean took the lead, pushing open the mansion gate and heading down the gravel path towards the house. I hadn’t even known there was a mansion around here. It had been so well hidden by the trees in an out of the way corner on the outskirts of town. We didn’t make it far in when the gates closed on their own behind us and a giant eight foot tall monster stepped out of the wood line cracking his knuckles. He looked like a cross between a man and a bear, the way his skin was covered in brown fur and he had beady black eyes over a small snout.

“Looks like I’m first pick here.”

“Careful rookie.”

“Please when it comes to pure strength no one can beat me. Besides, I fought him before. He just looks big and scary. His strength comes from taking on animal attributes. It’s not his own. Isn’t that right Harry?”

The snout opened in a snarl, showing pointed teeth, but a very human voice came out of it.

“Richard. This won’t be like last time.”

“You’re right. I’ll beat the snot out of you faster this time.”

The bear-man lumbered towards me as I cocked back my right fist and ran forward, letting out a growl of challenge. He swiped his right paw in my direction just as I skidded to a stop and twirled on my foot, letting the strike swing harmlessly in front of me. Around his exposed side I went, throwing all my weight into my first punch. The blow hit him solidly in the kidney making him roar in pain. Bending my knees I jumped into the air, catching him squarely under the chin with my left fist. As he spun around dizzily I jumped again to grab him around the neck, shoving his chin into my right shoulder as I slammed back to the ground.

I let his unconscious body fall at my feet as the bear form began to shrink and return to his normal five foot ten inch stick figure frame. Dusting my hands off I turned to the rest of the group giving them a small bow and putting out my hand to beckon them forward.

“The mansion awaits. Please enter as you wish.”

“Not bad rookie. Not bad at all.”

“The names Richard, not rookie.”

“Not bad Richard. I like you. I think you will fit in just fine with us.”

We continued on our way, almost making it to the front steps when we were met by an army of what looked like zombies. Mary stepped forward with a sweet innocent smile.

“I’ll handle these guys.”

“As you wish milady.”

Jean and the others stepped back a few steps. I just stood there wondering what she was going to do. Mac grabbed me by the collar and pulled me back, standing on the tips of his toes to whisper in my ear.

“It aint safe to stand so close. You might get burned.”

Ahead of us the zombies began to shamble forward. Out of nowhere a white fox tail appeared, sliding out from under Mary’s shirt. Then a second and a third. All three of them looked as soft as clouds as they waved back and forth in an invisible breeze. Soon there was a fan of nine tails all waiving as one, and a visible aura of blue energy in a bubble around her that caused us all to back farther away. She began to grow as well, turning from a short four foot tall girl into a five and a half foot beauty with a chest to match.

“Nine tails huh? She must be showing off for you rookie, sorry, Richard. She could easily finish this with two. They are just dead things after all. Mary didn’t even raise her hands or anything, simply walked right towards the army. When the blue bubble around her touched a zombie it turned to ash. Within seconds there was nothing but a pile of dust around her. She turned and gave me a wink with eyes that were now more fox like and whiskers growing from her cheeks. I felt my jaw beginning to drop as I stood entranced by her beauty.

She shrunk down into her normal childlike body as the tails disappeared and the rest of the group started laughing at me.

“Go easy on the kid Mary. Even a hardened veteran could get caught up in that enchantment.”

“They don’t call her the ethereal vixen for nothing!”

“What? I couldn’t get shown up by the newbie now could I? Besides I can’t help it my natural enchanting power increases the more tails I pull out. You should all be thanking me for the free show. I should make you pay for the dreams you are going to have tonight.”

“Anything but that! I’d be broke in a heartbeat!”

The four of them laughed and continued on into the house as I shook myself out of my stupor. As I hurried to catch up I thought they were nothing like I was expecting them to be on a job like this. They acted like this was just some walk in the park, not an important mission.

As we walked Mac would periodically launch little mechanical flies into the air. Each one sent information back to him which he picked up on a sort of radar he wore over one eye like a broken pair of sunglasses. Their dark surface making it almost look like he was wearing an eye patch. With his guidance he directed us towards the back of the house and away from any obvious traps. When we got to the back door Jean cracked his neck and grinned.

“Right. Now we run in and smash everything. I don’t know who or what we will find out there but be on your toes. Mary, think you got it in you to shoot a cannonball?”

“Please who do you take me for? Those zombies weren’t even a warm up. I’m still bursting with energy.”

“Just what I wanted to hear.”

Jean clenched his fist a moment before throwing them out to the walls on either side. When he brought them together metal of all shapes and sizes came flying towards us. Steel beams ripped out of the walls, pipes and bars came from the floor, even pulling in silverware and mirror frames. He rotated his hands while inhaling deeply. Quickly breathing in and out. With each breath the metal began to turn red hot, melting and fusing together into the shape of a cannonball as big as I was. He finished making it in only a minute, its exterior surface glossy and shiny like it had just come from a forge.

Jean backed away, the large black ball sitting on the ground in front of Mary who grew out two tails. She too inhaled a deep breath, her head thrown back as if she was about to yell at the ball with all her might. She did yell, but no sound came out. Instead a giant blast of blue energy smashed into the ball and sent it flying like it had been shot out of a cannon. The ball smashed into the door, taking the entire wall with it, shooting out into the night.

I began to run forward, suddenly realizing there were now at least a hundred people running all around me. I looked around and saw Joker giving me a thumbs up and a smirk. I knew then that these men and women were all illusions.

Off in the distance I thought I saw Yushihito getting to his feet and helping a woman to hers. No. That was impossible. He might be a bit of a dirt bag but he would never join a group like this. I didn’t have time to get another look to make sure though as I dodged a projectile someone threw at me. A rock came flying at Mary’s head and I leapt forward, stopping it in mid flight with an open palm and shoving it back towards the enemy. She threw a ball of energy at it, turning it into a dozen or more smaller chunks which struck like bullets.

“Everyone fall back! Johan! Get us out of here! Take us to the secondary base!”

“Yes Lady Mirror!”

The ground in front of us rolled like water seconds before splitting and rising like someone had made two giant hands to lift it as easily as a rug. It rose ten feet over our heads, curling over us and blotting out the sky.

“Gather together!”

Joker dropped his illusions as we all packed around Jean who was already breathing heavily. I saw liquid metals rising out of the ground and falling from the earth right over our heads. Even as the dirt began to fall in an attempt to crush us the molten metal formed a bubble around us and began to cool. The stones pummeled the shield as Jean stood there with his legs braced and his hands cupped in a dome shape.

The grumbling of earth settled and everything was quiet outside. I couldn’t hear cheers of celebration or anything. Jean turned his hands up like he was praying before parting them. The top of the dome split and parted in time with his moving hands, the metal almost a living thing under his manipulation. After boosting everyone up and out of the hole I jumped up myself. Mary grabbed my arm one handed and lifted me up like I weighed nothing.

Looking around, the place was empty. The enemy had retreated.

“Well not quite how I was expecting to end things, but a win is a win. Lets go find those prisoners.”

We all agreed to that plan, making our way back through the giant hole we had created.

11212.content:
Yuki meaning snow. Kami meaning god or lightning and shiro meaning white. Yes my name certainly fit me. Though how much of a god I really was could be questioned. I had received these visions ever since I could remember. The terror of the things I had seen had scared the color out of my hair. I had to use hair dye just to look halfway normal. Even then it started turning again after only a few days. I really detested this power. To know what was going to happen and rarely being able to change any of it. It made me feel so powerless. It was better not knowing. Better to think it was all random chance. Not a cascade of events that had started hours or days ago.

I stood in the shadows alongside the police station. I was no hero. But when I saw a vision of something I could change I had to try my best to change it. To make up for the million other times I could do nothing but watch. Thirty seconds. I silently counted down in my head, hearing the door creaking open at twenty seven seconds. Three seconds to let the officer walk away before I slithered around the corner, my back pressed against the wall. The cop was right in front of me, so close I could spit on him but he never turned around. I knew he wouldn’t turn around.

I let my foot slide back a fraction to stop the door from locking on me. But enough to make a clanking sound, fooling the cop into thinking the door had locked like it should. Quietly I stood there in the open until the cop walked away, oblivious to my presence. Once he was gone I backed into the door and entered the weapons shed. My hand snaked up and quickly entered the disarm code on the alarm. Once that was done I turned to face the empty room at large. There were three cameras in this room, the only blind spot was right where I was standing inside the door. There wasn’t normally a blind spot here but that crooked cop had altered the angles.

Two minutes. Just stand for two minutes and wait. Let the visions guild you Yuki. You are a god. The snow white god. No one can touch you. You followed the visions halfway around the world and they haven’t let you down yet have they? I concentrated, focusing on the mental image of a window like my mother had taught me. Opening the window let the visions in like a cool summer breeze. I focused my thoughts, seeing visions of the next five minutes to know exactly what to do.

God had a really messed up sense of humor. Giving both me and my mother this ability. Other kickbacks had the power lay dormant for generations. Yet without fail every generation of my family had someone with this curse. I had seen how my mother would die every time I touched her. It was my earliest memory of her. Not a smile or anything happy, it was the knowledge that she would be hit by a car when I was five years old. And she had known how I would die the moment she held me seconds after I was born. Truly a horrible joke. Having her afraid to even touch me for fear of seeing yet more visions. Being afraid to touch her for the same fear.

I had warned her about the car. But the next time I had touched her the vision had changed. This time being hit by a train. I could hold it off for a little bit with warnings but I had learned death was an inevitability. You couldn’t cheat it. If you are meant to die on a certain day then you will die on that day. So I had learned to keep my mouth shut. No one wanted to hear how they would die. They found happiness in their own ignorance. A happiness I could give them by saying nothing.

The lights suddenly went out as the power was cut. Quickly I dashed across the floor and slipped through the door the cop had left unlocked. I ran to the back of the warehouse and hid behind a large pile of empty boxes. I just got under cover when the sound of the door opening and three bodies entering. In my minds eye I saw what was happening just like in my vision. They began to plant C-4 all around the room. Hidden under the counter and behind stands of weapons. Stealing wasn’t their mission, though a few of them would pocket a few guns. It was to simply plant enough explosives to take out this police station and a city block or two. Enough to start a war. The door opened and the three entered the warehouse area.

They would be here for another three minutes and then they would leave. I would then have another ten minutes to disarm all the bombs and leave before the power came back on. All I had to do was sit and be quiet. They would never find me. I had to trust in the visions. So I sat quietly. A few footsteps came close as the three silently worked but none of them found me. So far so good.

Silently counting the seconds off in my head I waited for the three minutes to be up. At almost exactly one hundred and eighty seconds the footsteps all began to move away. My visions had proved true once again.

Suddenly the boxes in front of me were shoved out of the way and a hand grabbed me up. What the hell was going on? This wasn’t in the vision! I looked around frantically and saw there were four men and not three. Where had this fourth one come from? Why hadn’t I seen him in my mind?

“Looks like we caught a little rat just like the boss said we would. Hello little rat. Sorry you can’t scamper back into your hole.”

He began to laugh as I grabbed his arm wildly in an attempt to get out of his grip. Visions flashed into my head. He was holding me like he was now and suddenly a bullet went through his brain, splattering me with blood seconds before the other three went down as well.

The vision ended just as quickly as it had started and I blinked rapidly to pull myself back to the present. He began to turn his head when it jerked to the side. Just like in my vision the side of his head exploded outward as the bullet ripped through his skull. I felt blood and brains splatter my face just as I heard three more whizzing sounds that dropped the other three masked men.

“Do what you have to do. You still have nine minutes. I’ll clean up afterwards.”

I looked around wildly for the source of the voice. But it seemed to echo from everywhere. I could try to get a vision of who it was but if he didn’t show his face the vision wouldn’t show me anything. I stood there wondering what to do.

“Eight minutes child of the seer. If you can’t do it then leave. It will mean more work for me but I’ll disarm the bombs myself. Though it is supposed to be you who disarms them in this flow of time.”

I looked around one last time before finally running to the first bomb and yanking out the wires. I went about my task with single minded intensity. Guided by the visions I knew every place to look. Finally the last bomb was disarmed and I was slipping out the door just as the outside lights started coming back on. I let out a bit of breath as I jogged back to the small apartment I lived in.

What was going on here? My visions were never wrong. They were always accurate. Yet they hadn’t revealed the fourth man. Nor the shooter. Hadn’t revealed me getting found out either. Could the enemy already have gotten a hold of the power of prophesy? Somehow countering my ability with his own? If that was the case I needed to up the time table as well.

That strange man with the eye patch over his left eye had given me this chance to change the world. He had been the only one who’s future I couldn’t see. It was like he existed outside the flow of time. I had been able to touch him and not see his death. Not see anything at all. Yet he had saw me. He had saved me from death. He must have the same power as I did just stronger. He had asked that I live. Asked that I help him change the world with him. It had been the first time I had really thought I could so such a thing. That’s why I had been willing to fly here from Japan. He had even given me some sort of translation magic as well because he believed in me. I had to believe he knew what he was doing.

“The plot thickens. Isn’t that what you mortals say? Or perhaps it would be more apt to say the games afoot. Who were these masked men? This mysterious shooter? Even this one eyed mystery man for that matter. What devious plots brought this “Snow White God” to these lands? What is it he sees and knows that you do not? Shall we continue following him to find out?”

“Or perhaps you are worried about one of the others. Are their stories even related to this one? Well we can guess that Richard's is, but is Chris or Chel related to this story in any way? I don’t know. Well I do but I am not going to tell you. I mean don’t you find this exciting? Don’t you wish you could go back in time to find out? Or have the ability to see into all their minds at once?”

“Well you don’t! And don’t even think I will give you that power either! Well, if you figure out who I am hiding in perhaps I could give you that power if you wished for it. Though why would you wish for something like that when you could have anything at all? So what do you want to do?”

I quickly dodged out of the way as a six foot two hairy man built like a weight lifter in a blue frilly dress and high heals tried to grab me up in a bear hug. He came at me again with his lips puckered and again I dodged under his embrace.

Mr. Nobody came out of the living room scratching the skin under his left eye absently. The white eye patch he was wearing today beating lightly against his knuckles. I quickly went over to him and nodded to the guy in drag with my head, lowering my voice to a whisper.

“Who is this guy? I assume he is another member of our growing group. But what’s his deal anyway?”

Mr. Nobody grinned and held out his hand to the man who was now standing politely in front of us.

“Yuki Kamishiro. Please meet Cindy Santala. She is the newest member of out group and she will be very important to our cause.”

“Wait, this is a girl!”

“Woman actually but yes.”

“But she has a six o’clock shadow!”

“I’m sorry that I was born this way ok! I know I’m ugly! I’m horrible! I’m useless! A blight on humanity! No one ever thinks I’m pretty!”

She turned and ran off up the stairs, her hands covering her eyes as she began to bawl. Each footstep sounding like a cannon going off.

“Now look what you did. You made her cry. She’s very sensitive about her looks you know. You should know by now not to judge someone just by their looks alone.”

“…Sorry. I was just surprised.”

“Well I’m going out. I need to get a few things done in preparation for tomorrow. Johnny and Samantha are out back. There is another guy named Willis that’s out on a job right now. You will meet him later.”

“All right, later.”

He shoved on his shoes, grabbing his cane from next to the door before leaving. He didn’t need the cane, but it gave him the air of a refined gentleman when added to his slightly graying hair. Plus the cane had a sword hidden inside of it. I knew from experience he was quite adept with it too.

Kicking off my shoes I headed for the kitchen, making myself a quick peanut butter sandwich to stave off the small bit of hunger. I tried to clear my mind and listen to the news on the radio but I just couldn’t concentrate. After the third time of having the ticking of the clock intrude and break my meditation I gave it up as a lost cause. I knew what was wrong. It was that Cindy woman. I needed to apologize.

With a sigh I headed up to my room, opening my dresser drawer and pulling out the box of cookies inside. These were special chocolate ones I had brought from Japan with me. I hadn’t found anything like them anywhere around here and their taste was heavenly. With my peace offering in hand, I quickly found what door was hers by using my powers and knocked.

“Cindy? Mind if I come in for a moment? I’d like to apologize!”

“Go away! You’re a big meanie! A big fat poopy head!”

Meanie? Poopy head? What was she, like six years old?

“Please? Look, I’m sorry. I shouldn’t have judged you. I know what it’s like to be judged and I know I don’t like it either. I brought some special cookies from my home country as a peace offering.”

There was silence a moment before the door opened a crack and a red rimmed eye peeked out.

“Really? You won’t say mean things to me anymore? Or make fun of me anymore?”

“Really. I’d like to talk and get to know you a little better if we will be working together.”

The door opened the rest of the way and she stepped back to let me in. Inside was like stepping into a war zone where cute had taken over everything. Pink covers, fluffy pillows with lace, teddy bears and stuffed animals everywhere. Pictures of boys on the walls. It was like an adolescent girls bedroom gone wild.

She sat on the bed with her shoulders hunched, looking dejected and alone. Silently I handed her the box of cookies and sat in the chair at her desk, spinning around to watch her thoughtfully. She opened the box and took a bite of one of the cookies, her eyes lighting up as a look of bliss crossed her face. She still looked like a butch guy in drag wearing a dress but I could now make out the more feminine aspects. I had encountered a lot of strange people so far and she wasn’t even the strangest. It was just her looks had caught me off guard.

“Again sorry about what I said. It was really thoughtless of me.”

Her hand stopped with a cookie halfway to her mouth. She looked at the floor a moment before lowering the snack back down.

“You think I’m strange don’t you? Now that you have seen my room. You probably think, what’s a grown woman acting like a little girl for. But I can’t help it. It’s sort of part of my power. I can… control things. I put a little bit of myself in them and make them move. But because it activated in me when I was so young my body grew faster than my mind. Now even though I am always me I switch between Old Cindy and Young Cindy. It gets worse when I get emotional.”

“I wasn’t actually thinking that at all. I was wondering though if you were going to eat all those cookies without sharing any of them with me.”

Her face brightened up as she offered me the open end of the box. I carefully pulled out a cookie, making sure not to touch her hand. I took a bite, chewing it thoughtfully as I wondered how to proceed. I knew I had to be careful, I didn’t know what might set her off.

“Do you mind showing me your power? You said you can control things. You mean like people?”

“I’ve never tried it with people, though I suppose it would work. It would just take a lot more effort.”

She reached over and grabbed a giant stuffed teddy bear. Her hands glowed for a moment before the bear began to move on its own. She continued to go on talking while the bear did cartwheels and mimed kung-fu moves.

“Depending on how complex the thing I control is depends on how much of my power I have to use. Something like this uses very little. But something with gears or lots of moving parts takes much more.”

“Can you make things talk?”

“If they have a working mouth yes.”

“Is there a range to it or any limit?”

“Once I posses something I can go as far as I want with it. Though my control over it will become weaker after about half a mile. I can put a bit of myself into something without activating it and just let it sit there until I want to use it. But once I call the power back or the possessed item is destroyed I need to touch it again. What’s your power?”

“I can see the future. Only about five minutes into the future though when I do it myself. But sometimes they just come to me out of the blue and then it could be what will happen seconds from now or days from now. Longest I saw was two weeks into the future when I get those attacks. I also see peoples personal futures when I touch them.”

“Will you tell me my future!”

“No. Because I also see how they die when I touch them. I don’t like witnessing that. It feels like a part of me dies when they do. Because I don’t just see it happen I feel it happen. It is the only time I feel what happens in my visions.”

“Can’t you tell them how they are going to die and then they can change it?”

“No. I tried. Many times. It never works. The only thing that changes sometimes is the manner in which they die.”

“You have it rough in your own way too don’t you? Not being able to touch people. Must be hell trying to get in a relationship with someone. Knowing how they will die, seeing visions of them being unfaithful.”

“You don’t know the half of it sister.”

She gave me a grin which I returned. I hadn’t actually meant to say it like that but it seemed to make her feel better. Validation that she was a woman I guess. I got up and gave her a wave goodnight.

“Enjoy the cookies. I need to get up early for a job.”

“Oh? Where to?”

I need to go to church.”

“You don’t seem like the praying kind of man.”

“I’m not. But I’ll still talk to him while I am there. Perhaps a few choice words will reach his ears for the crappy life he dumped on me.”

“I’ll see you around then. And thanks for cheering me up ma petite peche.”

“Thanks for letting me in to cheer you up.”

As I was closing the door on her she blew me a kiss. I made sure the door was firmly shut between us before I let go of my shudder. I could get used to her looks in time, but that still looked too much like a guy blowing me a kiss for my comfort.
1121211.title: I think... I'll pass

choices: Ma petite peche! I'm here with you!
Chris! I'm sorry I left you!
11212111.content:
Just like Mr. Nobody had said the back of the church was completely unguarded. I used my power just in case, but found the back entrance and the basement room inside completely empty. Five minutes from now Mr. Nobody would begin his attack, covering our escape with the other members of the Knights. He hadn’t been able to guarantee a route free of opposition but he had guaranteed very little of it.

I liked the sound of our name. The Knights. Mr. Nobody had said if the enemy wanted to call themselves the inquisition it was only right we take a page from their book and name ourselves after a group that opposed them. I wasn’t sure what group that was but it didn’t matter to me. It still had a nice ring to it.

I ran to the back door and into the basement without a sound. Raised stage to the left, a staircase going upstairs to the right and a raised floor ringing half this room. Up the three small steps to that raised balcony area and into the janitors closet. Quickly turn the hidden switch and push the button to make the secret door swing out so I could dash down the steps. The small grating sound as the door closed again behind me was both reassuring and ominous. Three minutes before it started.

I navigated the catacombs quickly, making a beeline for the secret room. So far Mr. Nobody had been spot on about everything. So I had no doubt I would find Richard’s older half sister Robin tied up and gagged in that room. I hid against the wall right before turning the last corner. I let my mind go blank and called forth the visions, seeing the two guards in my minds eye. I played out every scenario in the space of a few breaths. Most of them got me killed. Of the ones that didn’t I got seriously hurt. I kept shifting through the possible futures until I found the one I wanted.

I wished my ability to see the future wasn’t so confusing and headache inducing like this when I called it up myself. Opening the window in my mind showed me every possible outcome of every possible choice at every possible time. When they came unbidden or when I touched someone it was only a single timeline that then became set in stone. Did I make that timeline a reality by touching them? Or was it some action that would happen no matter what? I didn’t like to think about it too hard. I had a hard enough time staying sane with the parts of my power I could control.

I counted to three and ran out of cover as fast as I could. Heading straight for the two guards. For this brief few seconds both of them had their backs turned to each other looking off into the darkness of two adjoining tunnels. As I got between them I raised my hands and chopped down hard on the backs of their necks. Aiming for and hitting the knot of nerves there. Any higher or lower and they wouldn’t be knocked out. Both of them crumpled to the floor and lay flat on their backs, their minds off in La La Land.

With that out of the way I pulled out my knife and entered the room. Seeing the woman in the chair just like I knew I would. Her eyes went wide at the sight of me and she began to struggle against her bonds. I put my finger to my lip but that didn’t seem to do anything.

“Relax. I’m here to rescue you. I know your brother.”

That seemed to calm her down a bit as I got closer to her. I was about to bend over and cut her ropes when I was assaulted by a vision of the future. It was seconds from now. There was a man standing in the door right behind me with a gun pointed at my head. He pulled the trigger and the world went black. I knew he had killed me even as the vision let me go. Without thinking, I grabbed Robin’s chair and threw her to the ground with me. I heard the pfft of air as the bullet left the silencer a split second before it struck the opposite wall. Quickly I got on my knees and raised my hands in surrender as he trained the weapon on me again.

“Don’t shoot! I’m one of the good guys! I’m here to rescue the girl. I assume that’s what you are here for as well? Your name’s Chris right? He said you might come. I’m Yuki Kamishiro. But we can save the explanations for later. Right now we need to get out of here.

After a moment where I could feel every bead of sweat on my brow he swung his weapon away with a grunt. As he turned to the door to watch for any enemies I began cutting the ropes on the girl. He was silent a moment before asking me how I had taken care of the guards. I told him as simply as I could. When he asked why I hadn’t killed them I deflected a bit, telling him it hadn’t been needed.

“You ever kill anyone before?”

“… No.”

“Well I took care of them for you.”

“You mean you killed them?”

“Yes. I’ve learned not to leave potential threats alive.”

“Oh.”

I took a quick breath as I gripped the knife tightly for a moment before sawing through the last bit of rope. The woman wasted no time in getting to her feet and ripping the gag from her mouth.

“Chris! Just what the hell is going on here? I suddenly get kidnapped, blindfolded and brought to this dingy underground room. Where are we and just who are you to talk about killing people so easily?”

“No time for explanations. Leave it at they want your brother’s power and they kidnapped you to get it. But this place is dangerous. The people who took you are in a war with another group who will send this place up in flames shortly. We need to get out now. So just keep quiet and follow me.”

“He’s right. There’s more to the story obviously but he covered it in a nutshell. This place is going to explode in about ten minutes.”

He seemed to know quite a bit about what was going on. Did he get visions like me? Whatever the case he slipped out into the hall and I followed him along with the woman. I felt a bit nauseous at seeing the bodies but I tried to ignore them as best I could.

“You got a weapon aside from that knife?”

“No. I don’t need any.”

“That won’t fly with me. I’d feel safer if you had something to defend yourself with at range. Not all enemies will let you get close enough for a karate chop to the neck.”

When he held out the weapon in his hand to me I put my hands up while shaking my head. I didn’t want that thing. I had never touched a gun before in my life. He let out an exasperated sigh and grabbed my hand, shoving the hilt into my palm.

“Really easy. Just point in the general direction and pull the trigger. It doesn’t matter right now if you hit anything or not. They will take cover as long as it is pointing in their general direction.”

I winced, expecting to see visions. But none came. I stared at my hand and then at him in surprise. This was the second time this had ever happened. I had found another one. He was safe to touch!

“You’re just like him! I can’t see you! You exist but at the same time you don’t! You’re outside the flow of time!””

He turned as if ignoring my words, continuing back towards the stairwell. He halted just before we rounded the corner and motioned for us to wait quietly. I activated my visions, seeing the two guys just out of sight. When he ran around the corner in my minds eye I shut it down. I knew he was going to kill them, I didn’t need to see it happen. Seconds later he ran around the corner for real. Coming back in less than a minute to have us follow him again.

We made it back into the janitors closet without incident. I could hear the sounds of fighting in the main area upstairs. Chris pulled out another pistol and waited at the door without doing anything. The moment the handle began to turn he slammed the door open, knocking the woman outside back. Shoving the weapon under her chin he pulled the trigger without hesitation, the sound of the shot being covered by the sudden onslaught of a sub machine gun being fired upstairs.

“Can you see the future too?”

“You could say that I guess. Though this is a future I have never seen. Now enough chatter. We aren’t out of here yet. Now we run.”

All three of us made a mad dash for the door. Chris outpaced us and had it opened by the time we got there. A vision popped into my head right as I was about to go through. It lasted only a second but it was enough. Without thinking I swung around and fired at the man just coming down the steps, hitting him in the leg just above the knee. Chris finished him off as he started to get up. After that we simply ran. It didn’t take long to get away, just a few blocks.

“Thought you said you had never shot a gun before.”

“I haven’t.”

“Well that was a pretty accurate shot.”

“I knew he was going to be there, I saw where I had to aim. It was nothing special.”

“Next time aim for the heart, head, or throat. Shoot to kill.”

“I don’t want there to be a next time.”

“Suit yourself. But that kind of thinking will get you killed one of these days. But now that we are out of the woods for the moment, how bout you tell me just what the hell is going on. Why were you there? Who am I just like? Why is the timelines so screwed up?”

His phone began to buzz then and he quickly glanced at it before gritting his teeth.

“God **** stupid woman! Can’t she follow just a simple request? Why now of all times!”

He looked at me and then at Robin before motioning with his head for us to leave.

“Get out of here. I’ll find you later. And when I do I want answers.”

When I tried to hand the pistol back to him he shook his head seconds before beginning to turn around.

“Keep it. You might need it later.”

With that he ran off, leaving me and the woman alone again.
11212111.title: Yuki at church

112121111.content:
Go to Peach and First and wait there. That’s what Mr. Nobody had said. There is a bakery at that intersection. Take the girl there and simply wait. It won’t be long.

I snuck a peek around the corner yet again just to make sure, but the snipers on the roof and the ones in the windows didn’t magically disappear. Had he known about this too? He couldn’t have. He wouldn’t have let me walk into a trap like this. This ambush only confirmed my suspicions that the enemy had someone able to see the future just like me. That was the only explanation as to why I hadn’t seen this coming. Their seer was more powerful than me or at least more skilled. Able to hide the manipulating he did from other seers like him.

I kept sneaking a peek at the future after every minute it seemed but it was always the same. No matter what I did or what route I took right now both me and the woman ended up dead. The only future where we stayed alive was the one where we simply waited here in the shadows. I was sure the enemy knew we were here. It wasn’t like there was much cover for us to hide behind. But for some reason they weren’t attacking or trying to capture us. Content to simply stay in hiding.

I heard a scraping sound behind us and whipped around, leveling my weapon at whoever was there. I didn’t know if I could actually pull the trigger and kill anyone or not, but I was on edge right now. Both from this hopeless situation and the deserted streets. Luckily it was only Richard. I wasn’t sure why he was here but I was glad he wasn’t an enemy. I dropped my arm just as Robin turned at my sudden movement, running into her brothers arms with relief all over her face.

“So you came like he said you would.”

“He? He who?”

“The guy that convinced me to fly halfway around the world. He calls himself Mr. Nobody.”

“Slightly deep voice? A bit gravely, like his throat was messed up?”

“That’s him. How’d you know?”

“He called me this morning and told me to come here.”

“I don’t know what his full game is since I can’t see his future, but I could use the help.”

“What are you talking about? He didn’t say anything about helping you.”

“Yeah? Well I doubt he planned on me being surrounded either. Or perhaps he did and that’s why he sent you here.”

“Surrounded?”

“Yeah check the rooftops and watch the windows of the buildings. I’ve looked into the future as far as I can and I’ve seen around twenty guys in all. But every future I saw ended up with me and the girl dead.”

“Why haven’t they opened fire yet then?”

“I don’t know. I can only see what’s going to happen, not the reasons for things.”

“What about now? You said in the futures you saw both of you died. Does that change now that I am here?”

I took a deep breath. Calming myself down and summoning the window in my mind like I had been taught to do under any circumstance. I pushed myself harder than I had before. Trying to see just one more second farther. See one more possibility. I felt the headache beginning to pound in my head as I went past the few seconds I normally left the imaginary window open for. Blood began to run down my nose, I felt it with a small part of my mind that was anchored to the real world. Soon blood would start to come out of my eyes and ears if I didn’t shut it down. I was almost at the point of no return. It was a struggle but I finally slammed the window shut and came back to reality.

“I’m sorry. I couldn’t see past my normal five minutes no matter how hard I tried. Most of the futures you died too and the ones where we didn’t I can’t say what happens after.”

“I’ll take it. Tell me what to do. Read the future on the fly if you can. We will go down one of the routes you saw where we didn’t die and just change things on the move. If we end up dead then so be it. But at least we won’t just sit her waiting to be slaughtered.”

“You’ll never figure out anything if you sit around doing nothing huh?”

“What’s that?”

“It’s something Mr. Nobody told me. When I was too scared to leave my house back in Japan. Too afraid of my power. He stood there with his hand out, looking down on me like some god from heaven. He said, what do you wish to accomplish? Are you content to hide away from the world doing nothing? Wasting away into oblivion? You have a gift. A gift not many other people have. With it you can do a great deal of good if you so choose. Whether your power really is a gift or a curse is up to you to decide. But how can you decide if you don’t use it? You will never figure out anything if you sit around doing nothing.”

“I took his hand, afraid to see what visions would come. Afraid to see how he would die. But nothing came. It was the first time I had seen nothing at all when I touched another person. When I asked him how that was possible he grinned and said that he was a man that was part and yet apart from the flow of time. That I could not see his future because his future had not yet been decided. And now that I am here I have met someone else just like that, who is part and yet apart from the flow of time that I cannot see the future of.”

“Interesting. I’d like to meet them both. But in order to do that we need to move. Tell me what to do and where to go. I’ll follow your lead.”

“But what if I end up killing us?”

“Then I’ll never forgive you for it. Now tell me.”

I clenched my fist as I stared at my feet. He would trust me with his life on so little? I couldn’t even guarantee that he would live. But I couldn’t just stand here doing nothing. I had to believe in myself. Like Mr. Nobody believed in me. Like Richard seemed to believe in me. I had the power to see the future. That meant I had the power to change it right? I had already changed the future. I could do it again. I just had to believe in myself.

“Into the bakery.”

He grabbed Robin’s hand and opened the bakery door without an ounce of hesitation.

"Oh now this is really getting good! Can you pass the popcorn? Oh wait, never mind, you don't have a body right now do you? Ah well. Not like I really need to eat anyway. Besides all that butter and salt would go right to my hips! And do you have any idea how long it takes to work that back off! I'll tell you! Two seconds! I mean I actually have to snap my fingers to get rid of it can you believe that? The problems with being a god..."
112121111.title: Ma petite peche! I'm here with you!

1121211111.content:
“Welcome! What can I get for you today?”

“Out the back.”

Richard ignored the man behind the counter, heading for the door in the back. When the man turned to say something to stop him I smashed the butt of my pistol on the back of his neck, leaving him snoring on the floor. I had never done this before, opening the window in my mind a crack and changing things as I saw them. Trying to focus only on a few timelines and not all of them. My head hurt but I pushed that annoyance to the side. I couldn’t let them down. They were counting on me.

I only barely noticed what was going on around me, the future being superimposed over my visions. I saw a woman getting hysterical and tried to calm her down. When she raised a rolling pin I pointed my gun at her almost automatically, reassuring her yet again that we would be gone in a moment. She set the rolling pin down and backed away as I told Richard about the single henchmen just outside. He waited until the twenty seconds I had given him was up and opened the door. By the time I followed him out and to the end of the alley the guy was already knocked out.

“Wait until my signal. When I say go, run across the street into the opposite alley. You have five seconds to do it. Think you can manage?”

“Easy.”

I felt his arm wrap around my waist with a dim part of my mind. I made sure to keep my hands clear of his touch. I didn’t need yet more visions overlapping everything. Though having him pick me up and run me across the road was a good idea. I wasn’t sure if I could have made it even if I wasn’t constantly seeing the future.

“Go.”

The sensation of being lifted and carried under one arm was weird indeed. Especially when my senses were fading in and out of reality. But soon enough he set me down and we continued on our way.

“Ten seconds from now that door ahead will open up, the person coming out is just a worker so don’t harm her. Slip inside. There is a stairwell to the left, go up it to the roof.”

He was already reaching for the door as it began to open. Another vision superimposed itself on the one I was seeing and I fired a shot without thinking. Tagging a goon jumping out of a window farther down the alley. We were already inside as the woman began to scream hysterically at the man who had hit his head against the ground when I shot him. At least he was down for a while.

We got to the roof and jumped across the alley to the next one. A quick run across the roof and another jump which Richard again grabbed me around the waist for. I warned him in time to take out three more henchmen as they burst out of the rooftop door we were going to take down. There was no way around this. Any other path lead to use dying or getting captured. At the bottom he took out the last guy that I warned him about and we were home free. We ran as fast as we could until my side began to ache. I had to tell him to stop before sliding down the brown brick wall we were standing next to.

“So Yuki. Care to tell me exactly what’s going on? You said yesterday the time wasn’t right, well if this time isn’t right I don’t know what is.”

“War. That’s what it boils down to. There’s this group called the Inquisition. They consider themselves some sort of holy crusaders. They think this world needs to be reformed. Humans are a disease to them. Something that has infected this world and needs to be purged. They believe they have been given a divine mission by god to cleanse everything. The only ones worthy of living are the “evolved” humans. Kickbacks like us. Though only if we share their ideals. If we don’t want to join them we are considered “infected” by the lower humans.”

“Though from what I know they don’t want all humans to die. Only most of them. They hunt down those with latent kickback powers, intent on activating them or at the least breeding them into existence. They think if two kickbacks with different powers have a child that child can obtain both abilities. There is proof of this, since their leader has two abilities that Mr. Nobody knows of. The rest of humanity that they spare will become little more than slaves.”

“And why exactly are they starting their fight here of all places? I mean Medusa City might be big, but it’s not exactly the center of things.”

“From what I know it is because of a prophesy of some sort. I think they have someone on their side with the ability to see the future like I can. But I think theirs is stronger than mine. This area is a place where a large number of kickbacks tend to gather for some reason. Though I don’t know why.”

“So what? You are running around playing at a superhero all by yourself?”

“Hardly. Mr. Nobody is pulling together everyone and anyone he can get and trust to fight them. Police, kickbacks, regular people. Not everyone can know of course, and we have to be careful who we trust even among those we tell. People just aren’t ready to accept those like us. Even among the non kickbacks helping us we are still held at arms length. They fear our power, fear we will switch to the other side. That’s why we need to be careful what we say. There are corrupt cops that the enemy is using as well.”

“There are kickbacks in the ranks of the cops?”

“Nope. They are hypocrites. Claiming to detest regular humans yet still working with and using them. Don’t ask me to figure out the minds of these people. All I know is they have started a war and they won’t stop if we ask them nicely with sugar on top.”

“So that’s this Mr. Nobodies game huh? He wants me to join you.”

“Not at all. He gave me no such instructions to try and recruit you.”

“Then why didn’t you tell me all of this yesterday?”

“Because he said it had to happen this way. If your sister hadn’t been captured they would not contact you. Then he wouldn’t have known what they were planning.”

“This Mr. Nobody seems like a bit of an A******. Putting people in danger like that for his own selfish reasons.”

“I’ve seen humanity. That’s all they are is selfish. Everyone is like that in some way shape or form. Manipulating and using others to get what they want. He might be a bit of an A****** like you say, but there is no questioning that he is effective.”

As I closed the window in my mind another one came in unbidden. I was already weary of the constant double and triple sights overlapping the real world. My head was killing me and I wasn’t in the mood to see anything else. It didn’t last long but I still saw every possible outcome of this one moment. As soon as the vision let me go I raised the gun and pointed it just to the left of Richard’s face.

“Don’t move.”

I counted to three and fired. He flinched but only after the bullet was past him. It slammed into the head of the man who suddenly swung around the corner with a machine gun in his hands. I stared down at the weapon in shock as the full import of what I had just done hit me.

“I killed him. I killed him! I didn’t mean to, I just… killed him. There was no other way. You got to believe me! I didn’t see another way! But I knew where to aim.”

I looked at Richard as if trying to make him believe me. I wasn’t a killer. I had wanted to live. That was all. I didn’t want to die. He had to believe that was the only reason I had killed him.

“You did good. If you hadn’t killed him he would have killed us right? And you can’t do anything to stop these Inquisition people if you are dead right?”

“Yeah… Yeah. You’re right. It’s just… that was the first time I killed anyone. It seems worse because it was the first time I used my visions to do it as well. People die all the time right? And this is a war right? I mean people die in wars so this is only natural right?”

“Right. Now pick yourself up and get moving. We can’t sit here all day. Did your Mr. Nobody tell you where to go once you were safe?”

“Yeah. Yeah he did. There is a safe house. He told me to go there and lay low.”

“Then let’s move it. I’d feel better if we weren’t out in the open. I can take care of myself but I don’t want my sister in any more danger if I can help it. I don’t know about joining your little resistance or anything but right now these guys are trying to kill me and you aren’t. So I’ll stick with you for now until I get a better idea of just what the hell is going on.”

“Yeah. Yeah. That’s a good plan. Follow me.”

I got a bit unsteadily to my feet and motioned for them to follow. He was right. Find someplace to hide. Keep moving. This was no time to have a breakdown. They were still counting on me. I passed the man I had shot, trying not to throw up as I saw my own handiwork. This wasn’t as easy as it looked on TV.

“First kills are always memorable. Though why you humans put so much stock on the importance of it is beyond me. What’s a dead body or two? Wars are what founded nations. Your pasts are littered with the bodies of the fallen. You would not have civilization without it. Yet you treat it like it is some sort of sin. Just get Grimalius to give them back if you are so concerned about it. She might have a bit of a morbid sense of humor but she really isn’t that bad.”

“Hmm? Who’s Grimalius? I told you about her before didn’t I? The one you call the grim reaper? Who escorts the souls of the dead and collects them? Oh right. Never mind. I bound my children not to interfere didn’t I? She is only allowed to escort the souls now. Not that she was much for socializing with others to begin with. So I guess you can’t ask for her help. Well you can, but she can’t do anything. So it would really do no good. She might appreciate someone talking to her though. Let her know people still know she is alive.”

….

….

“I’ll shut up now. Moving on!”
1121211111.title: into the bakery with Yuki

choices: You big baby! Lets just move on!
11212111112.content:
“Richard. Don’t turn around no matter what, just follow my directions. When I say now, dodge to the right. Same with you Mrs. Robin.”

“We got someone on our tail I take it? Someone with abilities?”

“Yes. And if you look back you will trip and fall.”

Even though I was already tired from all the other visions they were still coming into my head like I hadn’t closed that imaginary window. I still didn’t feel right about having killed that man but I was quickly getting over it. Oddly though, in this heightened state of emotion my head wasn’t pounding like it normally did. I didn’t see hundreds of possible outcomes, I simply saw one. As if it was the only possible timeline.

“Now!”

Richard sidestepped closer to me and Mrs. Robin, the black lightning puttering out in the air right next to his head. I didn’t know who exactly was chasing us, I had never seen him before but I knew his power was dangerous. It somehow embodied pain, debilitating and excruciating pain. If we were hit by it we would be withering on the ground helplessly. That is if it didn’t outright kill us first.

I continued to issue orders, allowing us to evade the lightning strikes. When he shot another bolt at my feet I jumped to avoid it, almost stumbling and falling when I landed. But I recovered quickly and kept running, my side beginning to hurt just slightly. The woman was beginning to pant as well. She could go on for a bit longer but not forever. We didn’t need to go on forever, our salvation was just turning the corner farther up the street now and barreling towards us.

“Yo! Cindy! What’s up girl! What are you doing here?”

“Ma petite peche! I was told to come here by Nobody. Told you might have a bit of a pest problem.”

“I do. As you can see it’s a cockroach that just won’t leave us alone. Mind stomping it out for me?”

“For you ma peche anything! I’ll hug him and squeeze him and rip his cute little head off just for you!”

Her voice became almost demonic as she talked, a drastic change from the slightly low sweet sounds she normally made. Her grin and the slight craziness in her eyes was also a surprise, making me glad she was on my side. I raised my hand as we passed each other and we mimed a high five pass off, our flesh never once coming close. It seemed she had already adapted to my no touch policy and understood how to handle it. I had a feeling I could come to really like her and we could become good friends.

“Who was that guy?”

“That was Cindy and she is a woman.”

“No way! He had a six o’clock shadow! His arms were bigger then mine!”

“It’s true. And don’t let her hear you call her a him. She is very sensitive about her looks.”

He left it at that as I led them both into the outskirts of a residential district. The hideout was an unassuming yellow house that looked just like four others on the block. It’s three stories standing like a sentinel against the street. Once inside I sat on the steps to catch my breath, winding down after all the adrenaline I had been working off of.

I began to laugh a bit hysterically as I thought back on the last hour. Never would I have thought I was capable of any of that. My head hurt a bit but I realized I had more control over my ability now. I would never have been able to do any of that before. Being thrust into that situation had forced me to expand my vision seeing ability. Had Mr. Nobody expected this to happen and put me in this position on purpose?

I heard the tapping of a cane on wood and knew Mr. Nobody was coming out of the back rooms without even looking. I didn’t even need to use my power to see him. I just knew. There was no other sound like that distinctive clicking.

“Mr. Nobody I take it?”

I looked over in time to see Mr. Nobody nod his head to the side at Richards question. Richard gritted his teeth and swung his large right fist around in a haymaker. My eyes were too slow to see exactly how it happened, just catching a faint glimpse before I blinked and it was over. It looked like Mr. Nobody shifted his weight to the right and slid around the big man in a circle. Pulling his sword out of his cane and laying it against Richards neck in a backhand swing. He didn’t cut the flesh, simply held it there with his back straight. Richard unclenched his hands and held up his left one in surrender.

“I hope your anger is spent now. I’m sure you must be ticked at me and that’s understandable. But like it or not things had to happen the way they did. Even if you can’t understand the reasons why. I’d prefer not to get violent if we can at all help it. We might not be allies or friends, but we are all on the same side at the least.”

“Yeah fine. But next time you put my sister in danger like that I won’t stop until you kill me.”

“I would hope there not be a next time. I am trying very hard to prevent such a thing. Yuki. I’ve got another job for you if you are willing. An easy one that won’t involve much danger.

“Is that why you are here?”

“One of the reasons.”

“Sure, what’s the job?”

“I want you to go back up Willis. He’s in room 404 of the Hilington hotel. The one a block away from City Hall. No need to rush, he won’t need you for another three hours and no one will bother you on your way over.”

I nodded my acceptance, leaving the house with a wave. My father had always said to never put off what you can do right now. I knew I had time, but I wanted to think. I did my best thinking while walking around. Mr. Nobody had already assured me I wouldn’t run into any trouble and I believed him. He hadn’t steered me wrong yet.

I had already done so much since leaving Japan that I had never in a million years thought I was capable of. I had friends! Real friends now. There were still people that feared me and my power. Even a few that threw proverbial rocks just like the kids back home had thrown real ones. But now I had people who stood up for me. Who weren’t put off by my power and still wanted to hang out with me. Who made me feel normal. People I wanted to protect.

This world was ugly, there was no doubt about that. Humans were creatures that couldn’t easily adapt to changes or things they didn’t understand. Tending to get violent against such things. Willing to destroy things that did not fit into their knowledge of how the world worked, even if it was beneficial to them. But they also had the capacity to accept if properly shown how. Not all people were bad. Even those who senselessly destroyed anything different had the capacity to regret and have their mind changed.

We weren’t trying to change the world though. Even if it would be beneficial for all kickbacks in the long run to do so. People needed to want to change on their own, we couldn’t force it upon them. If we forced it upon them we would end up with a worse rift between kickbacks and regular people than when we started. But like it or not, despite what Mr. Nobody said, regular people would have to be forced into accepting our existence, otherwise they would all stay willfully blind with nothing ever really changing. The Inquisition wasn’t completely wrong in some of their views, they were just going about it the wrong way. There would always be people that feared and hated us because we had something they didn’t. That was just human nature. But I still believed Mr. Nobody was right in saying most of them would come around eventually.

“Ma petite peche!”

I glanced up as Cindy came barreling down the street straight for me. When she got close she grabbed me up in a giant bear hug and swung me around like a rag doll. My arms were trapped under hers and it was all I could do to keep from accidentally touching her.

“Put me down please! You’re crushing me!”

She sat me back on the cement, grinning at me like a fool. Straightening my clothes out I looked up at her, reminded again of my short stature. Why did Americans have to be so tall? Or us Japanese have to be so short? Even at five feet one inches tall, I was small for a Japanese person.

“What does that mean anyway? Ma petite peche that is?”

“It’s French for my little peach”

She turned and began walking next to me as I started off down the road again.

“And why do you call me that?”

“….No reason.”

“That’s a lie if I ever heard one.”

“Promise you won’t get mad?”

“Promise.”

“My horoscope said so. It said the first person I met after reading it would be the one I was destined for.”

“And you believed it. You know those things are a bunch of hogwash don’t you? Just a generalization to make you feel good.”

“I know. But a girl can dream can’t she? I always dreamed of calling someone my little peach. My mother was French and she always called my dad that. I always thought it would be nice to do that too. And then you showed up and you are so small. Like an actually little budding peach. I just couldn’t help myself.”

“Great. I’ve gone from being human to being a fruit.”

“You’re mad.”

“I’m not mad.”

“Then can I still call you ma petite peche?”

“Only if I can call you Okii momo”

“What does that mean?”

“It means large peach in my native tongue.”

“It’s a deal ma petite peche.”

“Glad we came to an understanding Okii momo.”

“Aww. It’s the start of a beautiful friendship! I’m not going to cry. I’m not going to cry! I promised myself I wouldn’t cry this time!”

….

….

“Hold me! Whaaaaa!”

112121111121.content:
“Come in.”

Sliding the door to room 404 open I slipped inside. The room was a double, though I had a feeling he had taken it more for the position then for the beds themselves. The array of bullets and guns spread out on the far bed and the way he was looking through a scope out the window gave me that impression. Willis glanced back at me a moment before returning to looking out the window.

“So you’re Yuki huh? Not much to look at but I’m at least glad you didn’t wimp out on me last night.”

“You’re the guy from the police warehouse!”

“Figure that out on your own did you? Or did you use your power to help you?”

“You got a problem with me?”

“Yeah. You’re a freak. These abilities you people got is unnatural.”

“Then why you working with us?”

“Cause I have to. These Inquisition people have made an attack on my country. I’m not about to let no hair brained scheme of some power hungry freaks take over my country and kill the people I spent twenty years protecting. “

“Ah I get it you’re one of those redneck patriots. A hillbilly hick from some backwater town who thinks serving his country is the end all be all. As if this countries **** don’t stink and it’s the epitome of civilization. Land of the free my arse. Land of the ignorant and stupid is more like it. If your country is so advanced then why is it such a s***hole right now? Why you got these “freaks” as you call us ramming your own uselessness down your throat? If it weren’t for “freaks” like me and the rest, you regular hicks would be up the creek without a paddle.”

“Sod of you Gook. What would a chink like you know anyway?”

“I know I can kick your *** if I have to. I know none of your bullets will touch me. And I know I could kill you right now and no one would shed a tear at your loss. The only reason I don’t walk out the door right now is because Mr. Nobody said I have to work with you. He didn’t say I have to like you. And if you can’t be decent enough to keep your tongue in check I see no reason I have to either. I’ve had it up to here with you ****ing Americans thinking you are so god **** superior when in actuality you are the most ignorant ****’s I have ever seen.”

When he reached in front of him and spun around to point a gun at me I was already behind him grabbing the right hand with the weapon in it and pointing one of the pistols I had silently picked up from the bed at his head.

“Bang! You’re dead. Care to try again?”

Visions of how he was going to die flashed through my head the moment I touched his hand. But I ignored them like I had gotten good at doing as he swiveled off his chair and swung at me. I dodged the blows easily, knowing long before he even thought of throwing them what he was going to do. Ducking under another blow I put the muzzle of my weapon under his chin.

“Bang! Dead again. Another try?”

Again and again he kept swinging at me. I could have knocked him out many times over as I slipped through his guard. I killed him five more times before he finally gave up and sat back down with a sigh.

“God **** freak. Being able to see the future aint a fair advantage.”

“And I am sure you wouldn’t use it yourself if you had it. Because all Americans are such upstanding honest citizens who wouldn’t use every tool at their disposal. Now if you’ve gotten over your little tantrum and butt hurt feelings, let’s move on. What exactly am I supposed to do? The sooner we get this done the sooner I can leave and get away from you.”

He gave a tsk of disgust but turned away, pulling his light military jacket off to reveal arms tattooed from shoulder to wrist.

“Tell me where and when to shoot. I’m supposed to provide covering fire for some high ranking officials as they evacuate the City hall building. I’m just a regular old sniper. I’m good, but not good enough to react to the speed of a bullet or an explosion. Mr. Nobody wants you to see the future and tell me where and when to fire to stop incoming attacks and keep them from dying. Their bodyguards know to keep them moving already. Just need to get them safely to their cars and cover them until they drive off.”

“Wouldn’t their cars be the first thing targeted?”

“Aye, if the enemy is smart. That’s why Mr. Nobody is sending some armored vehicles during the escape. No chance of a car bomb.”

“You sure you can trust the words of a Jap?”

“Look I know my job. I might not like you people but we are technically still on the same side. Might not see eye to eye and probably never will. But you are at least trying to protect this nation same as I am. So I’ll trust your word. You tell me to shoot I’ll shoot.”

“Then move away from the window right now and pack up your stuff, we are moving to the next room over right now.”

He didn’t even hesitate or question me. Jumping off his stool and moving over to the bed seconds before a bullet smashed through the window right where his head had been. He looked at the hole in the wall up by the ceiling and then over at me with wide eyes.

“That would have killed me!”

“You’re welcome.”

“But when did you see that!”

“When I touched you. I saw how you were going to die. Depending on your answer I was half tempted to let it happen. Like you said, we don’t have to like each other, but we are still on the same side and fighting for the same cause.”

My head suddenly exploded with pain, forcing me to close my eyes and clench my fists against my head. Just ride it out. This wasn’t the first time this had happened. It would only last a second longer.

It stopped just as quickly as it began and I looked up to see Willis staring down at me stupidly. My body felt like a thousand pounds of lead as I pushed myself to my feet from the fetal position I was in. I didn’t even remember dropping to the floor. Staggering over to the stand between the bed I grabbed some tissues to wipe the blood from my eyes, ears, and nose. Trying to make the ringing stop.

“What the hell was that! Why are you suddenly bleeding all over the place!”

“Because I saved your life. I altered the course of your destiny. Now you have a future you didn’t have moments ago. Because I meddled with the natural order of things and stole you out of the claws of death I pay the price. A sort of overload if you will. It’s why I don’t save people very often.”

“But surely you can tell people how they are going to die and they can avoid it.”

“Your right. But it doesn’t do any good. I told a woman how she would die and she didn’t step out in front of the car like she was supposed to, instead deciding to take the train. That train derailed and smashed my mother into a wall, killing her instantly at the exact moment when the car was supposed to hit her. Right down to the millisecond. You can’t change moments that are set in stone like that so easily.”

“Then why am I still alive?”

“Because you were willing to listen without question. If I had tried to explain it to you, you would be dead. If I simply said move or die, you would want to know why and again would die. That’s the problem with humans, always wanting to know why. I know why but it still does no good to tell anyone. Because of ignorant people thinking this power is so great. Like I wanted to be born with it. Like I wanted to be unable to touch people without seeing and feeling their deaths. Thinking that I don’t want to be normal like everyone else. In the end you saved yourself just as much as I did. Now hurry up and pack up, we need to start soon right?”

We began gathering all the magazines and assorted ammo. Making the room look as clean as it had been originally. As we worked Willis kept glancing over at me speculatively before finally speaking up.

“So… your power. Do you see the future all the time?”

“No. I can control it to an extent. My mother taught me how before she died. But that only lets me see a short time into the future. Sometimes it comes on its own and then it can be anywhere within a two week time frame. They always come when I touch someone. I see fragments of what is to come and then I see and feel how they die.”

“I guess you people have your own problems just like us normal folk don’t you.”

“Sometimes more of them. Especially since we have to try that much harder to fit in. It’s not always easy. Like having to purposefully get answers wrong on tests so no one catches on to your power, or so you don’t get made fun of. Trying not to be too noticed so people don’t ask questions. It’s worse for some people who can’t fully control their powers or their power physically alters their appearance. How do you go to school when your skin is green? Or covered in scales? Or even having hyper sensitive senses that turn on and off whenever they please.”

He reached for the door after hiking the pack farther up on his shoulder. He turned the knob but didn’t open it, staring at the wood silently for a moment.

“Thanks again for saving my life. I guess you aren’t so bad.”

“Thanks.”

“I still don’t like you though you freak.”

“The feelings mutual you redneck.”

He nodded his head before walking out the door. I followed behind, silently smiling to myself.

“Waaaaaaah! Sob, sob, sob! Another budding friendship! You humans are so… are so…. Beautiful! Start as enemies and end as friends! Coming to an understanding through common goals and shared hardships! Feelings of love, admiration and respect blossoming inside from some offhand comment! This is why I shouldn’t destroy humanity! This is the special something about it I was searching for! These moments of bonding! It makes me so happy! It makes me want to rip my clothes of and go hug the first person I see!”

.....

“… come to think of it isn’t that what I did after that drinking match with my son Cthulu? Yes I really think it is. That’s how the whole Christianity thing started.....I think I better not do that again. We don’t need another fiasco like that. I’m still cleaning that whole mess up today."

…..

“Let’s just carry on shall we?”

“I’m back.”

With a sigh I pushed open the hideout door. Today had been exhausting. Every moment seemed to bring something new. Definitely not a dull day. I was tired, hungry, and at the limit of my stamina. I had overused my power, abusing it like I had never abused it before. I had only ever drained myself like this twice before so I knew I was playing a dangerous game. I was in need of a long rest while I gave my ability a break. If I pushed myself too much farther I would end up passing out and not waking up for a day or two.

I didn’t even want to think about the prophecies I might spew while unconscious. The last time I had done that it had caused widespread panic. Turning parent against child and letting utter chaos reign. It had taken the military almost a week to quiet things down and our family had had to flee the town.

I headed for the kitchen, thinking it was still weird not to hear someone say welcome back when I got home. American culture was so different. They didn’t put emphasis on the same values. It wasn’t exactly bad, just weird.

Opening the fridge I ransacked it for some leftovers that would be easy enough to microwave. Deciding on some beef stew to fill my stomach. I hit the buttons and turned around, nearly jumping out of my skin at the shrouded man before me. The only thing I could see under his deep set hood was a pair of purple eyes.

“Jeez Myste! Make some noise would you! Give a guy a heart attack!”

He bowed politely in apology.

“I am sorry. I simply wished to tell you welcome home.”

With that he turned into smoke, clothes and all, wafting out of the room on an invisible wind. Even though he was a kickback, the guy gave me the creeps. He didn’t talk much and he was always shifting in and out of his fog form. He was only two heads taller than me, yet he always seemed taller. And though I couldn’t prove it, I had a feeling he had two abilities, not just one. Since he seemed to always know what was on peoples minds, telling them exactly what they needed or wanted to hear.

Soon enough I was sitting alone at the table inhaling the food. I barely tasted it even though I knew it was good. I was just that hungry.

“Ma petite peche!”

Huge arms wrapped around my neck, threatening to strangle me as I was rocked from side to side. I tapped the table in surrender until she finally let me go, sitting down across the table from me and smiling like a fool.

“What’s with the grin okii momo?”

“Nothing.”

“Lies.”

“You wouldn’t understand.”

“You’d be amazed at the things I understand.”

She suddenly went from being a mature, if slightly happy go lucky woman into a bashful little girl. Red coloring rose to her cheeks as she fidgeted in her chair and looked away, unable to meet my eyes.

“I can’t say it! I’m too ashamed! It’s just so embarrassing!”

“You embarrassed? I would think you crushed embarrassment with one hand.”

She twiddled her thumbs while hunching her shoulders. Her lips moved and I strained to hear what she said but couldn’t, asking her to repeat it for me.

“You are the first person to really treat me like a woman and not some freak.”

“Doesn’t Mr. Nobody do that?”

“Yes but he is different. He treats everyone the same way. And I don’t think….. You.”

“What was that?”

She blushed an even deeper shade of red while hiding her face in her hands.

“I said I don’t think he is as cute as you! Oh my gosh I said it! I actually said it! What do I do! What do I do! What if he doesn’t like me now? What if he thinks I’m some kind of weirdo!”

“You are talking out loud you know.”

“Ack! I am! Oh no! Now you must think I’m even weirder!”

“No I don’t. I can’t even begin to wonder what it’s like to be you. Looking like you do and having lived the kind of life you did. But I’m sure it was hard. I’m flattered though. No one has ever said I looked cute before.”

I took a few more bites of food while Cindy kept glancing at me and looking away like a girl with her first crush.

“Are… are you not afraid of my power?”

“Why should I be? I think it’s pretty cool.”

“Most people think I am some demon in human skin as soon as they find out about my power. Afraid I’ll somehow curse them with my knowledge.”

“Can you curse someone?”

“Only if you consider telling them their future and how they are going to die a curse.”

She linked her fingers on the table and rested her chin in her hands, tilting her head to the side as if in thought.

“I guess that might be kind of bad. But it’s not like you cause it just because you tell them right? It’s going to happen one way or another. So it’s not your fault. And you don’t seem like you would tell people such things just to be mean.”

“Most don’t see it like that.”

Dealing with this sudden personality switch wasn’t as hard as I thought it would be. It was actually sort of calming. Take away her manly figure and looking only at her actions made it feel like I was talking with my little sister back in Japan. I felt a bit guilty that I hadn’t thought about her in all this time. I hoped she was doing well.

“I don’t want to sound rude or anything but how old are you anyway Cindy?”

“It’s no secret. I’m not like most girls that are afraid to tell people their age. I’m twenty three.”

“Get out. You can’t be a year younger then me.”

“Now you’re the one who is pulling my leg. You don’t look more than sixteen or seventeen. I mean you sort of remind me of my little brother! And he is taller than you! And where is your facial hair!”

I began to chuckle a bit.

“What’s so funny?”

“Well first because I was just thinking how you reminded me of my little sister. Second, I get the whole baby face comment a lot. That’s why I rarely say anything about my age. I don’t know if it’s just the way I was born, or if it has something to do with my powers or what. My mother looked years younger then she actually was too. As for my lack of facial hair, that really is something that runs in my family. All the men in my family are as smooth as a babies backside. Well all except for uncle Yuu. But we are all pretty sure he glues it on anyway.”

She began to laugh along with me, her demeanor changing slightly and I somehow knew she had changed back to the older version of herself.

“I must have looked like a bit of a fool. Clinging to you like I would to my own brother. Since everyone around here is a bit older I thought you would feel more comfortable with a big sister type around. I thought you were just acting more mature for your age so you wouldn‘t be taken lightly or something.”

“No more foolish then me treating you a bit like I would my own sister because I thought it would make you more comfortable that way. So then I guess you really don’t think I’m cute?”

She blushed again while lowering her head.

“No I really do think that. When I go into young me mode I tend to say whatever’s on my mind. You really don’t think it’s weird? The way I switch back and forth?”

“Not really.”

I held out my hand to her across the table, making my mind up on the spur of the moment.

“Would you like me to tell you a bit about your future? I won’t tell you how you die though if you don’t want.”

She looked from me to my hand and back into my eyes, searching for some trick. Finally she extended her massive hand and took mine. I felt my eyes shake back and forth as my mind was assaulted with snippets of her future. Finally I let go and pulled my hand back, giving her a warm smile.

“Well what did you see?”

“I saw me and you going out for dinner and a movie sometime soon.”

Her eyes widened in surprise as my words sank in before a slow smile spread across her face as well.

“I think I like that future.”
