When I rounded the corner I saw a woman let go of Chel and begin running off down the street.

“Who was that?”

“I don’t know. She said she was my mother.”

I looked again at the now empty street, narrowing my eyes in speculation. No it couldn’t be. It wasn’t possible.

“Do you know her?”

“No… She just reminded me of someone I once knew. Anyways what are you doing here? I thought I told you not to come around the church for a bit.”

“I could ask you the same thing. What are you doing here? Shouldn’t you be in school?”

I shrugged. “I ditched. Just like you did. But that still doesn’t answer my question, why are you here?”

She opened her mouth to answer when the street was rocked by a giant explosion. I braced my feet as Chel lost hers. I looked back quickly to see the church had indeed gone up in flames earlier then it was supposed to. I felt the adrenaline rushing through me. The thrill of battle underway. Perhaps I was a bit mad. Had a bit of what they called battle crazy. But I was ready for this war. This was my element. Where I felt most at home. But it was also the start of the end. Soon I would disappear from Chel’s life yet again.

“Our friend Chris here is a bit of a killer isn’t he? Puts a bit of a new twist on the phrase: a love to die for, don’t you think? Or perhaps he has some… killer kisses? I wonder if perhaps he might have… jumped the gun?”

“Ok, ok. I’m done. Didn’t think those were funny? Come on work with me here! I’m trying to connect with you, a bit of god to mortal bonding. Make you feel at ease! I heard you mortals say laughter is the best medicine. I’m just trying to understand you! Ah well maybe next time then eh? So what are you going to do now? Follow the bewildered beauty laying on the ground at your feet? Or continue to follow this enigmatic boy wonder?”

I also got a maid uniform I think would look good on you. I mean who doesn't look good in a maid uniform! Maybe some bunny ears and some fishnet stockings. Oh and we can't forget the tail! 112122.title: I'm worried about the others

113.content:
D*** it! **** it all! I’d get them. I’d get them both! Just wait. I’d have my moment. They’d slip up one of these days. All I needed was to catch one or both of them by surprise. No one made a fool out of me like that! I was Brian Yushihito! Didn’t they know who I was? I was descended from a great line of Japanese emperors. They should all be bowing and kissing my feet! One day they would all be working for me. I would rule this town. They would be working for me one day.

“Whew that was close! Almost missed the bleeping out for kid friendly ears. You picked a bad time to jump into his head it seems. Yes that’s right. It’s your fault I almost failed to censor him. You need to get better at this or I might have to take my power back. But I am nothing if not forgiving. That is why I forgive you and won’t punish you for your mistake. See am I not gracious? Well let’s see what else is on this petty man’s mind.”

“Hey boss are you all right? Your face don’t look so good. That gorilla worked you over good.”

“Shut it! This is nothing! It don’t hurt at all! I’ll be good as new by tomorrow just like always, you’ll see. Now get out of my sight!”

As soon as they were gone and I was sure they wouldn’t see me, I touched my puffed up face with my right hand and sent my power out through my fingers. Soon enough all my wounds were gone like they had never been. Such a useless power. The ability to heal was for people that wanted to help the world. Not for someone like me. What had this world ever done for me lately? Why should I ever want to help anyone? And why had my grandmother given me this power anyway? Why couldn’t she have given me something cool, like the ability to control fire or earth or make explosions with a snap of my fingers? Those I could have used. I could have become somebody much sooner. Not have to scrape my way to the top like this.

As I left the parking lot and headed off into town I grimaced silently. People were scum. Rotten filthy parasites that needed to be controlled and tamed. Needed someone to cull them and discipline them. That’s what they all wanted anyway. Someone to tell them what to do. To make their decisions for them. They were worse then sheep. Yet they never stopped bleating. Whenever anyone tried to step up and lead them they balked against it. Pounding their chests like an angry gorilla proclaiming to the world that they were their own person. That no one could tell them what to do. Then turned around and complained in the next breath that they didn’t know what to do. They were truly despicable.

A dog came up wagging its tail. Nasty creatures. Dogs, cats, humans. They were all the same. Only friendly when they wanted something. Food, money, sex. I knelt down and put my left hand on his head as he looked at me with those so trusting eyes. I released all the pain I had siphoned off from my face right into his skull and left his corpse on the sidewalk. On less piece of trash to dirty this already filthy world.

I looked down at my left hand and clenched it a few times. This at least was semi useful. When grandmother had taught me how to control my power this was not how she had meant for me to use it, I knew that much. My right hand could heal wounds and take away pain. My left hand could send out any pain and wounds I accumulated and put them onto another person or thing. She had called it the law of balance. She had spent her life healing other people, transferring their pain into things like rocks. And how had she been rewarded? By getting lynched for showing her power in public. Some of those in the mob had been people she had healed with her power.

That had taught me the most important lesson of my life. Don’t help other people. Take what you want and **** everyone else. But I was weak. I knew that. I had to manipulate and scheme to get what I wanted sometimes. Had to rely on the strength of others. But they were all throwaway pieces anyway. If they weren’t me they could all die.

As I turned the corner I saw a car coming from the distance. Right in front of me a boy dropped his ball. As he tuned around to pick it up I kicked it into the road. He went chasing after it like the little idiot he was. His mother screamed at him to stop but he ignored her. Unfortunately the car stopped before it hit the boy. A pity. The boy deserved to die for such a stupid act. I continued to walk on as the mother ran out to grab her son. She should die too. For giving birth to such a moron.

Even spending some time in the Arcade didn’t put me in a better mood. If anything it ticked me off more. Seeing all these people with smiles on their faces and laughter in their throat. Content to be scum. Content to live their dull lives. It was the duty of those of us with vision to lead them. To tame them and send them off to conquer for our benefit. And ultimately, to discipline them and remind them of their place. I was special. I knew I was. Grandmother had told me so. She had said this power of mine was far greater then I knew. **** the mob anyway for taking her from me before she could finish teaching me everything!

But I had showed that hick town. Those unenlightened maggots that had taken my family from me. They had never stood a chance. I had taken the opportunity presented to me. You had to always seize the opportunities. I bet they had felt so smug as they all gathered into the town hall for their town meeting. Probably discussing what a great job they had done in ridding the town of a witch. I bet the hadn’t felt so smug after I locked them in and burned the building down around them. Their screams of fear and pain as they burned alive were like music. Those that jumped out the windows I stabbed personally. Watching the life drain out of their eyes as I took revenge for grandmother’s death.

Some survived. Not everyone had gone to that meeting. But I hadn’t been satisfied with the hundred I had charred. Every single one of them were responsible. Even if they hadn’t participated they had allowed it to happen. They had silently agreed with it. They hadn’t come to her rescue. So I killed them all. One by one I slipped into their houses, their workplaces. They knew me. They trusted me. So they never saw it coming when I placed my left hand on them and shocked their hearts or brains with pain. I spared no one. Old, young, men, women, children, babies, they all deserved what they got. A town of only a hundred and fifty people, never to be heard or seen again. Such a sad story, it made you want to vomit.

How I wish I could just go on a killing spree here as well. But this city was bigger. I would get caught. I had almost gotten caught for the arson, until I had killed the police. I had to lie low for a while. Pretend to be one of these people. Fit into this society until my chance came. Then I would show them all.

I left the Arcade around four thirty. Once my desire to stab people became almost too much to bear. While walking around the shopping district four of my henchmen came out of an alley to meet up with me. I glanced inside and saw a woman with her panties around her ankles and bruising all over her body. I kept walking with a shrug. Served her right. That was all she was good for anyway.

“Hey boss. I heard you got worked over pretty good.”

“You heard wrong. Do I look like I was worked over?”

“No.”

“All right then. So drop it.”

We stopped for some pizza at a small restaurant over by MayB’s. Leaving only when I felt like going home. I was sick of this town for now. They were probably glad to see us leave But I would come back, just because I knew they didn’t want us there.

“Hey Boss. Isn’t that what’s his faces girl? You know, the one you are always fighting?”

I looked where he was pointing and saw a girl with blond hair in a light blue sweater and a skirt ending just above the knees walking ahead of us. I felt the grin slithering across my lips as I ran my tongue across them in anticipation. Yes that was definitely Chelsea. I would know that hair and that walk anywhere. She was alone for a change. Chris wasn’t around acting as her ever present bodyguard. I was going to enjoy this. I would capture her and rape her and beat the snot out of her. Perhaps even kill her. Make her boyfriend hurt.

We followed her. Slowly closing the distance between us. As I turned a corner I saw she was running away. I let out a yell of surprise and chased after her. She tripped and fell, making me grin. She would be mine. It was only a matter of time. Then she ran out into the middle of the street and crossed the road. A sea of cars suddenly blocked our ability to chase after her. I let out a tsk of displeasure at being thwarted and turned around.

I was met by a man almost six feet tall. He wore an eye patch over one eye and had a thick head of black hair. He was well built and wore the signs of many battles on his face and hands. My four goons were littered on the sidewalk around him either unconscious or dead. I hadn’t even heard him come up behind me or take out my crew. He held out his right hand as his single eye bore into me. Seeming to grow larger until it was all I saw.

“You are a kickback and you don’t know how to fully use your powers. I can teach you. I can give you power beyond your wildest dreams. The power to make everyone bow before you. I will make you a king. All you have to do is follow me.”

His words were irresistible. That gaze couldn’t be denied. I could feel the power emanating from him and knew how insignificant I was standing there. He could kill me as easily as squashing a bug under his foot right now if he so desired. He was like a god who had come down to earth and said I could become one to. My knees began to shake as my hand seemed to rise on its own to meet his. I was afraid like I had never been before. But he didn’t take his hand away. He grasped mine and shook it firmly. His lips curved up in a smile.

“Let’s start a war.”
113.title: Who's this Yushihito character?

1131.content:
How had I never thought to use my powers this way? He made it sound so simple and easy to understand. Only one night. That was all I had needed. Now much of what grandma had said made more sense. Some of the things she could do wasn’t so puzzling. I had almost been there. I could have even figured it out on my own. But he had helped. He saw more with his one right eye then most people saw with two.

He had seen the potential in me. Seen that I was somebody. That I could do great things if given the chance. Not as great as he was, I knew that. I could get nowhere close to how great he was. But he had offered me light. A way out of this hellhole of a life. A way to get rid of all these scum calling themselves humans by the thousands instead of simply by one or two.

He called us crusaders. Called us the Inquisition. Mr. Ghost said it was our divine purpose to reform this world. Our god given mission to wipe out the disease in the world and start over from scratch. Only us kickbacks deserved a place in this world. We deserved positions of power. Deserved to lord it over those without. To guild them. It was our sacred duty.

He had already given me a mission. He already trusted me and my god given power. He knew I could handle it. Even gave me twenty men. A simple mission maybe, but I knew it was a test. To make sure I could be trusted with tougher missions. He had already sent someone else out to abduct that muscled idiot’s sister. Robin I think her name was. She was being held in a secret room under a church on Peach Street. All I had to do was guard it with my men for one hour. Nothing I couldn’t handle.

How I wished I had been the one to capture that ***** of a woman. I would have given her a good working over. Screwed her head off too. Just to shove that Richard’s helplessness in his face. Show him just who was the one with the power now. But I hadn’t. Perhaps if I had time I would do that later while she was my prisoner at the church. If I couldn’t find the time to make that happen perhaps Mr. Ghost would give me a few minutes alone with her.

I grinned to myself as I pulled up my pants and looked around at the sparse room I had been given in this hideout. A window, four blank walls, a dresser and a bed where one of the women with the Inquisition was even now waking up. She wasn’t my woman, she was everyone’s woman. She knew her place. She was only good for birthing the next generation of Inquisitors. She knew if she could manage to give her child both hers and someone else’s power she would be treated like royalty. Mine or someone else’s child, it didn’t matter. So she made the rounds just like the other willing women, sharing a different man’s bed every night in hopes of being the lucky one.

I preferred the unwilling ones though. There was something about making them submit. About pinning them down while they screamed and hurting them before ravishing them brutally. Their tears of despair. I had wanted one of them last night, but all of them had already been taken. But I would have my chance. I would make them all my slaves. Bending to my every desire.

I left the room while buttoning my shirt, already imagining the things I would do. Imagining the torment I would inflict. I checked the clock on the wall and saw I had an hour to get to the church. More than enough time to get there early and set up my troops. They would all die before I let them fail me. Slipping on my shoes I left the house and got in the car, telling my chauffer to drive.

I was on the fast track. Only one night and already I had my own personal driver. Perhaps not my own personal car yet but that would come in time. I let my mind wander to everything Mr. Ghost had taught me last night, staring intently at my left hand. The hand that I had only ever been able to transfer pain into others with. I could see the faint traces of black aura that coated it and grinned foolishly.

I had known how to send that pain out through my hand, but it hadn’t taken much more effort to simply send it to my hand without releasing it. I could turn anything I touched now to char. Instead of killing something by instantly unloading it all into their body, this aura could kill them slowly, tormenting them in agony every second. It was limited of course, would last only so long as I had some of that pain energy stored inside. The longer I used it the more was drained away from that invisible tank.

Even though she didn’t teach me about it, I was sure grandma had known about this application of the power too. How to create this aura. I had seen it around her hand before. But unlike me she had never harmed anyone with it. I would avenge her with this power others had killed her for having.


“We’re here sir.”

I nodded to the driver as I got out of the car. That was more like it. Being called sir. Being shown the respect I deserved. As the black vehicle drove off I climbed the front steps to see just what I had to work with. I pointed and gave orders and they all jumped to do my bidding. Just the way it should be. They all feared my power. Feared me like they were supposed to.

“No one gets in here do you understand! All of you will die before you fail!”

“Yes sir!”

They began to pull out guns, slapping them around until clicks were echoing all around the chapel. I saw the cross with Jesus nailed to it back by the podium and flip it the bird. There was no god in this world. No god would have taken my grandmother from me like that. No god would be so cruel as to make human beings so evil. But the model Jesus kept smiling at me. Like he forgave me for disliking him. His face ticked me off.

With a growl of frustration I threw out my left hand, sending that pain power I was storing up out like a bolt of lightning. It struck the crucified false god square in the face, causing it to explode. I let the grin spread across my face as I felt better. This was something my grandmother could never do. It was something Mr. Ghost had taught me. I had already surpassed my grandmother in this respect. I already knew how to send the pain into people while I was touching them, and forming it around my hand like a protective barrier was almost an extension of that. So shooting it out by focusing it into a compact ball, holding it back on an invisible spring until I released it to erupt forward was just a natural next step. It was power. It was the destructive force I had been searching for. No one could stop me.

But now I needed to recharge. My little fit, while satisfying, had drained my reserves. I could feel the emptiness inside. The emptiness Mr. Ghost had taught me to identify. I needed to learn how to hold back. Learn to make it last and portion out how much force I used. That’s what he had said. But why should I? There was ever renewable resources everywhere. If I drained myself I could just go out and fill up again. These human waste were all nothing but battery packs to me.

“I’m leaving for a bit. Don’t anyone dare slack off! If you do you are the next one I target!”

“Yes sir! I mean no sir! I mean we won’t slack off sir!”

I smirked as I left the church. Perhaps that demonstration of my power had been more beneficial then I had thought. They might have thought I was some snot nosed kid who didn’t know anything because I was younger then them. But I had just put them in their place. Perhaps I should kill one of them. No. Not yet. That would come in time when they failed me. Instead I stalked the streets, looking for a good target. One that wouldn’t be missed too quickly.

“Hey there handsome. Care for a little fun?”

I licked my lips as I turned to the hooker standing on the corner. Yes, she would do nicely. Her blond hair reminded me of that whore of Chris’. What was her name again? Chelsea. She motioned to the alleyway next to her before slipping into the shadows. I followed her in with a swagger.

“So what will it be handsome? A Quickie is fifty, and oral is twenty.”

I grinned even wider as I cupped her cheek in my right hand and shoved her into the wall. She faked a look of pleasure at my touch as I sent my power out.

“I wouldn’t stick it in you for all the money in the world. Wouldn’t know what diseases you would infect me with. What I want from you is your life.”

Her face went wide in shock as I grabbed her by the throat with my free hand. I watched her skin begin to wither and shrivel as I literally sucked all the life out of her. Healing away wounds and pain with my right hand was all I had known how to do before. But the way Mr. Ghost had explained it, all I was doing was speeding up the healing process the body naturally possessed. But even cells in the body died naturally. They all had a life span. By speeding up that lifespan I could suck away the power as the body ate itself trying to correct the imbalance. I was literally healing her to death and sucking away the pain before she even felt it.

When I was done I let the husk fall to the ground, kicking a few bags of garbage over it before leaving. I was filled to the brim now. I could feel that imaginary tank of energy sloshing over with power. As I walked back towards the church I looked at both my hands, clenching and unclenching them with a smile. I was a god. I would rule this world. Everyone would bow down to me eventually. No one could stop me. No one would dare oppose me ever again!

The church came in sight as I refocused on the task at hand. The sound of gunfire penetrated my ears as I got closer. I began to run. What was going on? I made it to the steps right in front of the building when I was suddenly lifted off my feet and thrown across the street. I felt my head smash into the brick wall and darkness begin to take me. Through blurred eyes I saw the church was on fire. What had happened? Why had it turned out like this?

As I slipped into unconsciousness I thought of the hostage. I hoped she burned slowly in this blaze.
1131.title: Yushihito's evil....but I like it!

choices: What's the lovable crazy guy up to?
11311.content:
My head was pounding as I came too. I heard noises, lots of them. Blaring whistles and screaming sirens. As I blinked my eyes a bit against the blurriness I saw Chris run past, taking the arm off one of my men in a negligent swipe of a sword. No wait it was a dagger. But how could he do that with such a small dagger? His slut chased after him a moment later like a dog in heat. Prancing through the carnage as if it made her all hot and bothered.

How dare someone blow up the church I was supposed to guard! It was probably that pain in the *** Chris. He was probably running away from his actions. I wouldn’t doubt that b****** Richard had helped him. I’d make them pay. Make them whither under my hands.

I tried standing up but couldn’t seem to find my feet to begin with. They just wouldn’t work properly. I looked down to see what was the matter and saw both my legs were broken, the bones sticking out of the skin. Funny, it didn’t hurt at all. Must have pinched the nerves or something. Well no matter, I could fix this. I reached down with my right hand and laid it on my right knee, sending the healing magic out but nothing happened.

What the hell? Why wasn’t my power working? Oh yeah, my tank was full from that whore earlier. One of my men across the street moaned like the pitiful trash he was. His charred face staring at me, begging for help as he reached towards me with his hand. I released a bolt of black lightning into his face, causing his body to explode and rain his gory bits down on the other corpses and dying. Now my tank was empty and I could fill it again by healing myself.

Soon enough I was on my feet and looking around. I so wanted to follow that ***** whore. But the sound of sirens was too close. I needed to get out of here. I couldn’t be caught by the worthless police. My men had failed me. Chris had sabotaged my mission. None of this was my fault. Mr. Ghost would see that. I had done what I was supposed to. It wasn’t my fault that trash was still trash. I needed better minions. He couldn’t fault me.

Hobbling down the sidewalk, I used the buildings next to me for support. I was still a little woozy and my tank was full again from healing my legs. I didn’t want to waste anything right now to take care of my head. I could just deal with it. A boss like me should be able to handle a bit of pain no problem. I slipped between two buildings moments before a fire truck came around the corner and passed me. Get away, get my head on straight and then get revenge. It was a good plan. A flawless plan.

“My my. This Yushihito fellow is a bit loopy don’t you think? And has a bit of a mouth on him. Keeping me on my toes bleeping out his foul words that he is. Does he even know how much money it costs each time I do that? Well ok it doesn’t cost anything but still, it’s the principal of the matter! Though his mouth isn’t as foul as this sailor I once knew. That old saying about drunken sailors… well it has some truth to it. He was a really drunken sailor though… kept mistaking me for a wench. So I finally gave him a bit of a romp. That sobered him up right quick let me tell you!”

“Wait… what were we talking about again? Oh yes! Yushihito! He’s an interesting character to say the least. But I rather like him. He has a certain charm to him. Quite entertaining to listen in on his thoughts. Perhaps you could take a page out his book for a bit. Having two crazy people around would be quite enjoyable. Perhaps go out on a killing spree together with me? Make it a bit of a night on the town as you would call it. Just a god and two mortals having a good time.”

“Not interested? A pity. But I still have time to change your mind. Perhaps continuing to follow him would change it for you. Oh! Oh! Here’s a thought! Perhaps Yushihito really is you! How would you feel about that? What if the twist is I am secretly hiding in this body mimicking you! What would you think about that!”

…..

…..

“Nothing? Not even a rise of indignation or negation? Man you really are no fun. It’s like you have no personality or something. Like you are just some random person reading a book! No investment at all! You won’t even talk back to me! Do you hate me that much! I just want to be loved!”

“… Wait I didn’t give you a voice did I? You are basically just a pair of eyes floating in an unformed nebulous of energy jumping from mind to mind. Well butts…. Forget I said anything then. Lets return to our anti hero shall we? Or would he be more of a villain? Hmm.”

I really was a chosen one. There might be no gods in the world but someone was looking out for me. Someone knew I deserved everything. There ahead of me was that B****** Richard and some black haired freak. And they had that whore Robin with them! Where the hell did they think they were going with my property! Who did they think they were to try to steal from me! I would make them pay!

I threw out my hand to send some lightning their way when I held back for just a second. Wait Brian. Not all at once. I couldn’t refill quickly right now. Portion it out. Remember what Mr. Ghost said. I concentrated and sent out just a little power.

Somehow they knew what was going on without looking back. At the last moment Richard dodged out of the way and my strike zapped harmlessly next to him. Again and again I fired. Each time they moved as if by magic. Never once breaking stride or looking back at me. This was beginning to tick me off. They should just stand still and get beaten like the dogs they were! They should feel honored to be destroyed by me.

A giant of a guy who was almost as tall as that piece of trash Richard came barreling down the street wearing a pink frilly dress. Someone like that deserved to be put out of his misery. Someone like that was worse then a dirt grubber. He was an abomination.

They yelled something back and forth but I was too far away to hear more then the bleating of sheep. In the end the cross dressing man ran past the small black haired guy and they slapped hands like they were tagging off. Who did they think they were? Defy me will you!

I fired another bolt their way as they ran off, leaving the faggot behind. He whipped his hand behind his back and threw a teddy bear into the line of my blast. A god **** teddy bear! The bear exploded into little bits, the stuffing flying everywhere. Teach him to throw toys in my way.

He swung his big meaty fist at me and I rolled under it. I was half tempted to grab one of his pigtails and send him a bit of my love but decided against it. If I did that he would hit me for sure. Only after I put some distance between us and was turning to face him did I realize I wanted to get hit. Maybe not a full body blow but if I could get clipped it wouldn’t be so bad. I could siphon the energy off from my own body. An ever renewable source. I would never be defeated ever again.

The burly guy pulled out a purse while grinning at me. A purse! Was there no end to his obscenities? He opened it up and dumped out the contents on the ground. I was half expecting to see make-up and other girly things. Instead, dozens upon dozens of teddy bears, stuffed octopus, giant nutcrackers and even a few oversized toy cars spilled out. How had he fit them all into that little thing? And what did he expect me to do? Sit down an play house with him?

To my surprise all the stuffed animals got up and took fighting positions, some of them jumping onto the cars which were moving on their own. He charged at me again and his army of cute things followed him. I began firing off blasts left and right but there were too many of them. When I shot at the faggot a stuffed squid jumped in the path and he kept on coming.

I threw out my hand yet again but I was out of juice. I had used it all up and there were still too many. I batted away a stuffed rabbit that launched itself at my face even as a bear somersaulted off a car through the air to land a kick to my stomach. The breath was knocked out of me but it did no damage that I could heal.

I looked up in time to see the ham hand hurtling towards my face. I would surely die if that connected. So I threw myself backwards, landing on my butt but not having my head knocked off. The little power I got from siphoning off the pain in my backside wasn’t enough. It was best to make a tactical retreat for now. Using what I had gathered I planted my hand on the ground and sent it all out, making the road explode upwards in chunks and allowing me to run while the cloud of dust obscured the gay guys view.

Next time I would be better prepared. Next time I would kill them all.

“Yes this guy is certifiably bat **** insane. Oops! Had to bleep myself there! That’s so meta isn’t it? Don’t know what I’m talking about? Oh well. He also seems to be a real coward. But I guess that’s what makes him so loveable. All he needs is the crazy eyes to complete the deal. You know, like on TV when one eye is like three times bigger then the other one. Maybe a laugh that gets annoying when he uses it all the time. Like kekekekeke. Or ishishishishishi!”

“Oh look I spy another time rift over there! Do you want to chase after this loveable coward? Or do you want to check out the rift? I promise I won’t ask you to cos-play for me this time…”
11311.title: Wakey wakey....

113111.content:
“You’re back! Come give me some love!”

My ears were assaulted by the annoying woman’s high pitched voice as soon as I opened the door. The whore slid to a halt as I came through the portal with a look of disappointment on her face.

“Oh. You’re not Mr. Ghost. Get away from me you creep.”

Somehow I couldn’t let that pass. I knew I was inferior to Mr. Ghost, but I definitely wasn’t inferior to this mere woman. I was going to be the next boss. She should be throwing herself at my feet. Begging for me to bed her.

“Know your place woman. How dare you say I’m lower than you! I might be inferior to Mr. Ghost but I am still worlds above you!”

“Please you creep. That oily hair, that pale sickly skin, those deep sunken sleep deprived eyes and that twig of a body. You are inferior in every way! Worlds away from Mr. Ghost with his black hair peppered with white streaks making him look so dignified. That single blue eye staring out at you from under a brow that always seems to be brooding and in deep thought. The way his black eye patch gives him a more dangerous look while also conveying the softness underneath his cold exterior! That chest that sticks proudly out like a beacon and a demand for obedience, coupled with his rock hard arms that can hold you so gently. Even his cane gives off the stature of his gentlemanly ability! Ah Mr. Ghost! Hold me!”

The woman with an overlarge rack went dreamy eyed, hugging her chest and twisting back and forth as she described Mr. Ghost. I could almost see heart bubbles popping around her it was so sickening. I’d teach her. I reached out with my right hand to suck the life out of her. Maybe I would stop once she was old and grey, her boobs sagging. Not kill her outright. She could still be useful.

Before I could touch her though a skeleton hand suddenly clamped around mine. I looked down and saw a black hole opening up at her feet. Out of the hole the rest of the skeleton crawled into existence, reaching out to grab the disconnected arm still attached to me. It popped the bone back into the socket joint and stood there while I rubbed my suddenly icy flesh.

“Skelly won’t let a disgusting creep like you touch such beautiful skin. Who knows where that hand has been. Mr. Ghost might have picked you up last night but you aren’t one of us. You’re little better then one of these lackeys. I’m ranked number three here you know. Know your place worm.”

I gritted my teeth, grinding them back and forth in vexation. How dare she! I felt a pain in my right hand and realized I had clenched it so hard I had broken the skin. I grinned as she began to turn and walk away. I’d show her. Siphoning off the pain as I healed the wound I shot a bolt of black lightning at her. The skeleton stepped into the line of fire and exploded as she turned back to face me. The skeleton began to reassemble itself as she raised her eyebrow.

“It seems the scum needs to be taught a lesson. Minions! Arise!”

More black holes opened up in the floor and dead bodies started crawling out. Some little more than skeletons, some looking almost human save for bits of missing flesh and organs. One was missing the top of its head but was otherwise a healthy looking man. I heard noises behind me and turned in time to see more rising up. I was surrounded by a good thirty zombies.

“Work him over. A good beating should put him in his place. Don’t kill him and don’t eat him though. You might get indigestion and I don’t want him as another toy. I suppose you shouldn’t tear any of his limbs off either, Mr. Ghost probably wouldn’t be happy about that. Go to town.”

She walked away as the zombies began to converge on me. I punched a few of them but they felt no pain. Nothing seemed to hurt them. One of them hit me in the back before another punched me in the side of the face. I healed myself and shot lightning but it wasn't effective. One of them swept my legs out from underneath me right before another stomped on my balls. I curled into a ball to try to minimize the damage. **** that woman! **** her all to hell!

Hmmm. She must be one of Grim’s brood. Though I didn’t know that she had sired any children in her time. I thought she was more interested in simply ferrying the souls of the dead and watching quietly like me. Poor boy. If only he was smart enough to realize he could use his right hand to turn them to dust. Decomposition is just the process of time. Same principal as his healing ability. But, there is no accounting for crazy.”

“I’d like to see a match up between zombie girl here and the stuffed animal user wouldn’t you? That would probably be pretty funny. Who do you think would win? My money is on the stronger one.”

…..

“What that wasn’t funny? I thought it was. Sigh. Well lets get back to Yushihito shall we? Now that he has had the snot kicked and beat out of him.”

I’d teach that slut yet! Who did she think she was cheating like that! That wasn’t a real fight! That didn’t count! I’d make sure she withered and screamed under my hands one day. I’d turn her into my toy. I was going to be the boss someday after all!

I finished healing my broken legs, discharging the excess into the ground. When I went to fix my broken arm the healing magic wouldn’t work. What the hell? My tank was on empty! My power should work!

“Idiot. You might have the power to heal but it’s not infinite. It uses up stamina. Run out of stamina, run out of your ability. It’s the way all our powers work. It’s the great equalizer. That’s why sometimes the only way to win a fight is to outlast the enemy.”

I clenched my teeth while looking up on this intruder to my helplessness. I didn’t know who he was or what his power was, but he was looking down on me as I laid curled up on the floor. I didn’t want to ask for his help. Someone like me shouldn’t need anyone’s help. Holding back my tears of frustration I raised my hand in his direction.

“Please. Help me.”

“Help yourself. You chose to pick a fight with the princess. Serves you right for not backing down. Perhaps this will teach you that you are far from top dog around here.”

With that he walked off, leaving me alone gnashing my teeth and my anger boiling. Even though I had lowered myself into asking for help. Even though they were kickbacks like me. They were still humans. Still worthless trash that deserved to die like everyone else. I would bide my time though. That’s what I had always done. I would get past this and pretend to be one of them. When the time was right I would destroy them all. I had been a fool to think these Inquisition people were any different because they had powers like me.

A hand touched me on the head and I looked up in surprise to stare into the face of an unassuming woman wearing glasses. Her long brown hair fell off her shoulder and dangled just above my face. She smiled softly at me like some goddess before her eyes rolled up in her head and jumped back and forth like she was reading. It lasted only a second before she looked at me again.

“Ah, healing. A nice power. One that can be used for both good and ill. A very handy one for our cause.”

She gently laid her right hand on my broken arm after squatting down beside me. I watched in amazement as my bone shifted back into my skin and the flesh sealed itself up. She continued to heal me, expelling the power into the floor like I had been doing. She had the same power as me! She was just like me!

Soon enough I was completely healed and she offered me a hand up which I took hesitantly.

“W-who are you? And how do you have the same power as I do?”

She smiled at me, her white teeth seeming to dazzle the eyes. A light seemed to come from inside of her and I couldn’t help but grin foolishly in return.

“The name is Carla, though everyone around here calls me Lady Mirror. I’m the second in command. As for having your power, I sort of borrowed it from you for a bit. That’s my real power, to borrow the powers of other people. I can hold two powers at a time but have to give one up if I want to carry a different one. When I take someone’s power, I know what they know about it. How to use it like it was my own.”

“Then does that mean I don’t have any powers anymore?”

“Not at all. I just mirrored them, nothing more. I don’t know why you joined us or how you got that way, but you should be careful. You are an important member of our group now. It might take the others a while to warm up to you so don’t push yourself too hard. I hope you don’t think too badly of some of us, we all have our reasons for being here. Will you continue to work with us to change this world? Will you continue to follow us?”

“I-I’ll follow you to the ends of the earth!”

She gave me that sparkling smile again before nodding and walking away, waving without turning.

“I look forward to working with you. I hope we get along and I can count on your powers when I need them!”

The rest of these mud suckers could go screw themselves but this Carla was all right in my book. She had the same feeling as Mr. Ghost. I wouldn’t mind following her anywhere. I could tell she was special.

“I see a bit of lovesickness in Mr. Crazy pants here. Even a crazed unbalanced psychotic coward like him needs to feel loved. Perhaps that’s all he needs to fix his case of the loonies. I bit of attention, a bit of a kind touch and a good woman to worship.”

“Then again maybe such a thing is too late. Right now he seems pretty insane. A little too far over the deep end if you know what I mean. well, let’s see how his story ends.”

…..

…..

“That was a bit of a spoiler wasn’t it? Dang it! As punishment I will only take three women and two men to bed later instead of the usual four and four! I hope that will teach me a lesson!”

…..
113111.title: What's the lovable crazy guy up to?

1131111.content:
“Everyone! I have an announcement to make!”

The entire crowd went silent as if a switch had suddenly been hit. The backyard was filled with everyone staying in this mansion hideout. I hadn’t even thought so many people were here. But tonight was a celebration. I don’t know exactly what was being celebrated but I wouldn’t turn down unlimited food, beer and women. Looking around there had to be at least twenty to twenty five kickbacks milling around staring at Mr. Ghost who was standing on a raised platform. To his right stood the beautiful Carla and to the left that slut who controlled dead people.

“We have had a few setbacks recently. Today being one of the worst. The group known as the Knights that oppose us are a formidable foe. But although they thwarted our plans, they did not completely stop them. We still managed to destroy that institution the lowly humans call a school! Where they teach their young to live in ignorance and promote their false sense of superiority. Where they brainwash the next generation into hating and reviling us!”

“We also had some success in destroying the city hall. Unfortunately some managed to escape but it is a good start to a war! If we continue like this there will be no one to stop us!”

There was a wild cheering all around and I grimaced in disgust. Even though he didn’t say anything I knew he was disappointed in my failure. I had no reason to cheer with everyone else. He raised his hands for silence and got it.

“But we can’t get too excited! With the Knights already opposing us, they too are growing stronger even as we speak. Forming alliances with the powerless humans! But what we lack in numbers we make up for in power and quality! We are the superior race remember. To this end I am going to be leaving for a while. I am going to go seek out others of like mind to join our cause. I will send them back to join our ranks as I recruit them.”

“I will take only one other person with me, to carry on my work if I shall fall. while I am gone I leave the running of the Inquisition to my left and right hand ladies. Lady Mirror and Lady Shale. Treat them and follow them like you would follow me! Their orders are to be taken as my orders! Does anyone have any problems with that?”

“I aint going to follow no woman! I joined because of you not some skirt that should be spreading her legs!”

Mr. Ghost lifted his cane and pointed it at the seven foot tall monster of a man with scales all over his pale skin. I didn’t see what or how it happened but a small hole suddenly appeared between his eyes as the skin began to bubble outward. He even had time to blink once before dropping to the floor dead.

“Anyone else have a problem with this arrangement?”

No one else said anything. If they disagreed they made sure to keep silent. I didn’t care. If Lady Mirror was in charge I would follow her without question. The people nearest to the body moved away quietly, distancing themselves from being thought the man’s friend.

“Can I have him? Can I please? I don’t have a toy that big yet!”

Mr. Ghost waved his hand and the zombie girl jumped joyfully off the small stage and ran over to the dead body like a little school girl. She reached down and touched the corpses leg, causing dozens of necrotic arms to rise out of the dirt to clamp onto the body. A black pit opened up beneath it, the hands pulling it into the depths before closing up again.

“Te-hee! I got a new toy! I’ll make sure to give it lots of love tonight! Chop, chop! Sew, sew! A little power and away it goes!”

She twirled around a moment before skipping back onto the stage to stand behind and to the left of Mr. Ghost again.

“Continue to follow orders and we will prevail! Remember! We are chosen crusaders! We have been given these powers by god himself! Given this power because he saw how corrupt and tainted by evil it is! He gave us this duty to cleanse the world of that taint. To rule over the unenlightened and to bring forth a new era where our power is not shunned! Where all shall have a place and those who cannot understand our ideals shall serve us. We are divine rulers! We are gods! We are the Inquisition!”

Another cheer went up as everyone went crazy, throwing bottles of beer and food into the air. An orgy of gyrating flesh that made me want to vomit. They were acting like the trash we were supposed to rule over. Gods such as us should not act like rutting pigs. We should act more dignified. But in the end that’s what separated us even in our own ranks. Not all gods are created equal. I was proof of that. My reservation in the face of this celebration was proof that I was better then all of them.

I watched as Mr. Ghost waved farewell to everybody and simply disappeared. He didn’t fade away or sink into the floor, one minute he was there and the next gone. No one else seemed to realize it at first except me and the two on stage. When they did they looked around in confusion before going back to their celebrating.

The two new leaders left the stage and began mingling with the rest of the kickbacks. I was content to simply stay in the shadows by the house. I didn’t need to mingle with losers like this. I was here for only one reason, to destroy everything. To make all the people who had looked down on me pay. To destroy this system that had taught its children to hate. Taught them to fear people like me and my grandmother without cause to the point of killing us out of hand. Now I would teach them why they would really fear us. I would make sure their fear was justified.

“Don’t like parties?”

I looked over at Lady Mirror who was sitting down next to me, showing off that dazzling smile of hers. Suddenly the world looked a bit brighter and I found myself telling her the truth before I could stop myself.

“I don’t mind parties, I just don’t like people.”

“Any particular reason?”

“Because people are all worthless trash. People are what killed my grandmother after she spent her life helping them with her power. People are what is wrong with this world.”

“Surely not all people though. I mean you are a person too and so am I.”

“What’s it to you anyway? I’ll still follow orders and do what I have to even if you don’t ask these questions.”

“Why not? Knowledge is power. Knowing how someone thinks is important in deciding how to make best use of them. Plus it makes my power stronger. The more I know about the person I take a skill from the stronger that ability becomes. A sort of affinity if you will. Even though I might have your healing power right now, you could heal with it longer then I could and heal more serious injuries then I could right now. It’s a strong power, but it isn’t unbeatable or without its flaws.”

“…. Not all people. But I haven’t found many that I am willing to leave off the list.”

“Am I one of them?”

“Yes.”

She grinned again and I felt light in my chest. I slowly smiled back.

“Why are you so nice to me?”

“Because I save my scary side for my enemies. You haven’t made yourself my enemy yet.”

“Do you smile at your enemies too?”

“Of course. It’s only proper that they get sent off to the afterlife with a smile.”

“Oh.”

I felt a rumbling in the ground seconds before everyone else noticed it. They all turned to look back at the house the same as I did. I don’t know what caused me to grab Lady Mirror around the waist and into my chest while throwing myself away from the wall. Or what made me send my black aura out around our bodies like I did. I hadn’t even known I could do that until this moment. But when the wall exploded outward and a giant cannonball smashed into my back I at least wasn’t crushed. My aura took most of the blow, disintegrating the ball of iron even as the two of us were launched through the air.

The aura cushioned our fall but puttered out right afterwards. My tank was at zero again from just that one burst. But at least we were both alive. Carla looked up at me in shock, her beautiful crimson colored eyes blinking at me.

“You saved my life!”

“Yeah I suppose I did.”

“Thank you.

“Welcome.”

I got slowly to my feet, helping Carla to hers. When I turned around I saw what looked like hundreds of people swarming through the hole and the yells of the other kickbacks saying we were under attack. As if it wasn’t obvious.

“Everyone fall back! Johan! Get us out of here! Take us to the secondary base!”

“Yes Lady Mirror!”

A man who looked like he was part Indian the way he had beads braided into his hair and his dark skin planted his hands on the ground. I saw thin white lines begin to spread out like spider webs from his position. While he was working Carla stepped forward with a smile spread form ear to ear. But it wasn’t the sparkling smile she gave me, it was one full of evil. Though none of that evil ever touched her eyes, which made it look even more sinister. She put her hands behind her back a moment before raising them up in a forward arc.

The ground bubbled in front of the people running towards us, finally breaking and rising into the sky, first five, then ten feet into the air. It curved over the enemy, their yells of bravado turning into screams of fear. Those screams were abruptly cut off as she dropped her hands back down, dropping the tons of earth on top of them.

There was a bright flash of light as the white cracks Johan had made seemed to engulf us. I blinked away the white blindness and found myself in an empty hall of another mansion. But I had no clue where this was.

“Good work on the teleportation Johan. All right! Everyone lets get this place set up! Parties over. Time to get back to this war! And remember! Do it with a smile!”

"Yes Lady Mirror!"

11311121.content:
This really wasn’t all that bad. I needed to figure out a way to get my mom and sister to come over here for a bit without alarming them too much, but I had already seen how this city was starting to go to pot. Mr. Nobody and the rest of these Knights were doing a decent job of holding things together, and the other families under their protection seemed happy. Almost normal in their everyday lives. Treating this a bit like a vacation while at the same time knowing the seriousness of the situation. Those that couldn’t fight or do anything directly beneficial to the cause helped how they could. Such as cooking and cleaning. When I had asked around unobtrusively I found they did it of their own free will, no one was expected to pay for their keep as it were.

In fact these Knights were like one big messed up family. Some of them had powers, some of them didn’t. There was bickering and a bit of distrust but also a sense that even if two people hated each other they would have each others backs. Robin was already starting to integrate herself with these people, well I suppose I should think of them as my people since I was a Knight now too.

I leaned back in my chair after finishing off some of the best spaghetti I had ever tasted. It had been a long time since I had been able to eat as much as I wanted until my stomach felt like it would explode. There were four others around the table aside from me and Robin. I didn’t know them all that well or what their powers were but they seemed to be a pretty tight knit group the way they bantered with each other.

Mr. Nobody walked in, his eyes locking on our group a moment before heading in our direction. The other four saw him and gave a slight wave but didn’t bother coming to attention like I had seen a few others do.

“Ah Jean! I finally found you.”

“Yeah right. I bet you knew where to look from the get go.”

Mr. Nobody’s lip curled up slightly. “Perhaps.”

“So what do you want boss? Got a job for us?”

“I do indeed. One I think is suited to your teams unique skill set. I got word that the Inquisitions leader is going to go out recruiting. I’ll be leaving to try and stop him. But this does open up an opportunity for us. My sources say they are having a celebration tonight and will all be gathered in one place. I want you and your team to go party crash. Force them to relocate and set them back a bit. They have prisoners they are using as breeding stock being held there as well. If we can put them on the run, there is a chance to save many of them. Perhaps even capture a few for information.”

“Sounds easy enough. I take it you are going to leave Myste in charge while you are gone?”

“With you as second if you don’t mind.”

“An honor.”

I looked at Mr. Nobody a moment narrowing my eyes in speculation before speaking up.

“These are the people that kidnapped Robin right?”

“Yes.”

“Mind if I go too then? I want to get a bit of payback.”

“Up to Jean here. This is his mission now.”

“I don’t mind. I can get a chance to see what the rookie can do.”

Mr. Nobody nodded and walked away, leaving the six of us still sitting at the table. Jean wasn’t a big man like me but he had muscles. Not the gross bulging muscles of a bodybuilder that did nothing but lift weights all day. His was the muscles of a hard working man. And his slightly weather worn face showed it. He was probably pushing forty but his hair was already starting to turn grey. I found it a bit fascinating though that his hair wasn’t one color like most peoples, it was three shades that I could see. Black, brown and red intermingled with the white, giving him a very odd first impression.

“Like the hair?”

“What?”

“My hair. You were staring at it so intently. You like it?”

“Well I just thought it looked a bit strange.”

“Yeah I get that a lot. It comes from using my ability. I’ve just grown used to it so it don’t bother me anymore. So rookie, what is your power anyway? Or don’t you have one? It’s fine if you don’t I’m not like some of the others that got a problem with it. In fact Mac here aint got a lick of it but we haven’t booted him from the team for that yet.”

One of the guys to the left with black hair and glasses raised two fingers in greeting before going back to sipping his coffee.

“Strength. Insane strength.”

“Cool. Can’t wait to see it in action. Joker over here is an illusionist.”

“Don’t call me Joker! My name is Johnathan!”

“Right, right. Sorry I forgot.”

“You did not! You did it on purpose!”

“Just a slip of the tongue.”

“Joker” was a flame haired boy who couldn’t be more than thirteen or fourteen. Scrawny and gangly, he hadn’t grown completely into his body yet. His freckled face turned beat red until it almost matched his hair before he folded his arms and looked away.

“Anyways Jok…. Johnathan as I said is an illusionist and Mary over there is… well its kind of hard to explain what Mary is exactly. Her power isn’t exactly like ours.”

“What do you mean?”

“He means my power doesn’t fit into a single category like the rest of yours does.”

I looked over at Mary sitting next to me. She too was a surprise. When I had first seen her I had thought she was a grade schooler. A misconception she quickly dismissed when she lit up a cigarette and told me she was twenty three. She had the body and looks of an eight year old, barely topping four feet tall with big childlike eyes. Her pure white hair was long and curly, almost dragging the floor. Her green eyes seemed to be able to look into your very soul when she stared at you.

“My power comes from a Nine tailed fox spirit. So I do a bit of illusion and a bit of trickery but mostly I am energy. That’s the best way to describe it.”

“Energy?”

“You’ll see later.”

I looked back at Jean, raising my eyebrow in curiosity.

“So what’s your power?”

“Metal. I can bend metal at will. Iron, copper, refined, raw. If it’s a metal from the periodic table I can manipulate it with my bare hands and my will. Melting, smelting and reforming it within the space of a few seconds. I’m a descendant of Hephaestus, the Greek god of the forge. As such my body is my forge. My breath my bellows, and my will the fire.”

He picked up his fork and held it up for me to see. I sucked in his breath, letting it out slowly. As I watched the fork melted as if by an incredible heat, reforming into a tiny silver colored rose. He passed it across the table for me to inspect. Upon examination I could see it was really a rose and not just an illusion over a fork.

“Already refined metals are easier to control, most of the impurities have already been pulled out of it. When I pull raw stuff from the ground it takes a bit longer because I have to refine it myself. It was a great skill when I worked in the steel mills before they shut down. And like all abilities, it comes down to stamina. The bigger and stronger the thing I make, the more stamina it takes. It’s a good balancer, makes you invested in working out if you want to make your power stronger.”

Jean pushed his chair back and stood up, looking around the table at each of us.

“Well I’m going to go see what information I can get out of Mr. Nobody about the lay of the land for this mission. Also talk to Sara and the other seers, see if they can tell me anything.”

Everyone waved farewell with a good natured insult chasing him out of the room. Once he was gone Mary looked at me with an grin plastered on her face.

“Don’t let him fool you. He may act all meek and mild like that but he is a real monster. Probably the strongest of us after Mr. Nobody and Myste. He has the nickname The Diamond Knight for a reason.”

Staring off at the door where Jean had left I began to wonder just what I was going to see later on today. Just what had I gotten myself into? Robin put her hand on top of mine and I absently covered it with my right. She was telling me to be careful without saying anything. A fact I already knew but it was good to be reminded of it by her. I loved her, but I knew it would never work out. So I would hide my feelings and continue on like normal. We were and could only be brother and sister.

“Oh an epic battle! A showdown of kickback versus kickback! Five against an untold number! This is so exhilarating! Exciting! Exhausting!”

“Wait no, not exhausting. Hmm, what’s another good “ex” word to put in there? Ah! I know! Explosive!”

…..

“You try narrating what is going on to a mortal so their mind can comprehend it! Do you think it is easy filtering out all the random thoughts and images for you? Adapting the thoughts into a more pleasing format? Making the unintelligible emotions they are feeling into thoughts you can understand? And what thanks do I get? What thanks have you given me so far? Nothing! You don’t appreciate me! I work so hard for you and you just take it for granted! Why don’t you love me! All I want is your love!”

11311122.title: I haven't heard from Chris or Chel in a whi...

113111221.content:
With a groan I shoved a bit of rubble off of me. The fire suit had protected me from the heat of the explosion and the magnetic repulsion shield had stopped the brunt of the building from crushing me. If I had been more prepared for this I could have hunkered down to wait out the destruction better.

Climbing the demolished steps I shoved a bit of broken building out of the way, pulling myself out of my tomb. I was about to head towards the gate when I saw Chel standing there screaming her head off calling my name. What was she doing here? Why hadn’t she gone home?

Wait. This was good. I could vanish from her life now. It would make getting around easier. I wouldn’t have to hide who I really was from her anymore. Wouldn’t have to pretend to be just an ordinary high school student. So instead of coming out into the open, I kept hidden until she eventually left. Once she was gone I headed for the back wall, leaving the ruins of the school behind me.

“I’m sorry Chel. It’s better this way. I’ll see you again in a few weeks when we start things from scratch.”

She couldn’t hear my whispered words of farewell of course, but I imagined they still reached her. A police officer stopped me as I was walking away from the wreckage but I really didn’t have time to deal with him. The time for playing the role of a high school student was over. This was now war. So I brushed his hand off my shoulder and kept walking.
He reached out and grabbed my arm, starting to twist it behind my back saying I was coming with him. With a deft spin I reversed the hold, cranking his arm behind his back seconds before grabbing his neck and snapping it.

“Halt!”

I looked back to see another officer pointing a gun at me and sighed. I really didn’t need this. I put my hands up in surrender as he came towards me. The moment he took his eyes off me to talk into his radio I pulled my own pistol from behind my back and shot him in the head. In all the confusion one or two more dead bodies wouldn’t be noted. That is if this world even cared about throw away characters like this. I’d be surprised if they even had a name.

I needed to get to City hall. That was the next major key point in this series of events. Everything was happening faster than it was meant to. The church, the school, probably even the police station bombing. Other things were happening out of sequence, such as my faked death, Chel meeting Richard, the escalation of this war. Still, what had to happen had still happened even if the order was messed up. That meant City hall was the next target. I had to make sure everyone in the building was caught in the explosion. Or at least I had to make sure the government officials were killed.

It took longer then I thought it would, the streets were already awash with mobs of panicked citizens. The military was already trying to restore order but to no avail. Of course they wouldn’t be effective, they hadn’t been given orders to open fire with live rounds yet. The best they could do was shoot beanbags and tear gas. That would only give them breathing room though, a cleared space only as big as the perimeter they could hold. If they started breaking off and venturing out into the streets alone or in packs of two’s and three’s they would be overrun by the mob.

I skirted their perimeter around the building, glancing up at the fourth story window of the Beechton hotel, seeing the glint of reflection off a sniper scope. Good, that much was still the same. I would just sit in the shadows and take out anyone he missed. He normally didn’t miss anyone but every so often that variation did happen in the timelines. With the way things were going I wouldn’t be surprised if he missed every single one of them.

Another glint from the fourth floor of the Hilington hotel made me pull out my retractable spyglass to check it out. There was someone up there with a sniper rifle as well. There was only supposed to be one shooter, not two. I couldn’t make out his looks clearly because of the reflections in the window but I just knew he wasn’t here to assassinate anyone. This was another glitch to the order of things. I had to put an end to this now.

I slipped into the ally between the Beechton and an Italian restaurant, pulling bags off the pile of garbage in the dumpster there. It took only a moment to uncover the sniper rifle I had planted earlier this morning. Another moment more to grab the clip from where I had taped it under the giant blue dumpster. Securing the silencer onto the tip I flipped the cap off the scope, hefting it to my shoulder before leveling it at the fourth floor window of the Hilington.

Shoot to kill. Guns are weapons, not toys. Pull a gun with the intention of firing it. Brother, sister, mother, friend. These words don’t matter when you point a gun at them. Who might mourn their passing, who might come get revenge, these too do not matter. What matters is your commitment. That is why you must think of all of this before you pull out your weapon. Once it is drawn and pointed, that is your commitment. Your intent to fire and to kill no matter who it is pointed at. Uncle Chris’ words reverberated in my head as I let out my breath slowly and pulled the trigger.

I didn’t have time to confirm the kill though as the side door of the restaurant began to open. Quickly I hopped into the open dumpster and covered myself with the black bags full of garbage, shoving the rifle down along the inside of the metal tub. Yet another glitch that wasn’t supposed to happen. A rain of half eaten food, old sauce and much more rained down on my head, the bulk of it being stopped by the trash bags. I resisted the urge to gag at the smell as I waited for the sound of the door opening and closing again.

Climbing back out I cleaned myself off as best I could before making sure the rifle still worked. Once I was assured it was fine I waited. I didn’t have to wait long before the City hall building went up like a firecracker. A few bodies flew through the air, flailing their arms wildly before connecting with the ground or denting in a car roof. Hefting it back to my shoulder I used the scope on my weapon to get a better view.

The first congressman came out the door. I waited a moment for the sniper in the hotel next to me to do his job. But nothing happened. With a sigh I took the shot. Instead of going through his head like it should have something hit my bullet in mid air, making a small spark.

What the hell was that? I shot another bullet, and again I failed to kill my target. I picked another one of the officials running out of the building and fired. It flew right in front of his face because he had suddenly stopped. The reason for his sudden halt was because someone had shot the ground right in front of him. I glanced up to the Hilington hotel quickly through my scope. There in the corner room was the glint of a scope. The angle was bad so I couldn’t get a clear shot at him but I knew he was the cause of this. I fired a round in his direction, hoping to cut him up by breaking the window. But he jerked away before it even broke.

My interference did allow the sniper in the hotel next to me to take out one of the officials. Well it was no big deal, even if they made it to their cars, the bombs I had planted early this morning would take them out as soon as they fired up the engine.

Even though I continued to lay down covering fire, the sniper in the other hotel still managed to stop almost all the shots. To make matters worse, instead of getting into their own vehicles, a group of black armored sedans came barreling out of nowhere for the officials to be ushered into. Soon enough all six vehicles were out of sight and only five congressmen and senators had been successfully killed. All in all a total failure.

With a disgusted sigh I broke down the weapon, throwing the parts into the dumpster and covering it over with garbage. It was untraceable and I could always get another easily. The only thing I could do now was go home and get cleaned up. With a little food in me and some clean clothes I could figure out my next step. Figure out how to salvage this mess and correct the course of time. Because at this rate Chel would end up dead tomorrow.

The trek back to the house went by in a daze. A few people took one look at me and gave me a wide berth. I didn’t mind. As long as they didn’t try to stop me. The farther I got from the center of things the less it seemed people knew what was going on or that anything was going on. Soon enough they would though and nowhere in this town would be safe or free of panic.

Reaching up above the door frame to hit the button my fingers froze. It was already depressed. The trap was deactivated. Somebody who knew about the trap had been in my house. They might even still be in there. As silently as I could I opened the door, slipping my .45 out of its holster as I did so. The house was quiet and dark just as I had left it, but this was just the entranceway. I couldn’t call it safe from just this.

No. Not completely quiet. I could hear the faint sounds of the TV in the living room. Step by careful step I slid across the floor, cocking back the hammer before twisting around the frame ready to fire at the first thing that moved. Sitting in the chair with his legs crossed and his fingers steepled in front of him was the person I had never thought I would see again. I blinked my eyes rapidly but the vision didn’t change at all. Slowly I lowered my weapon as I felt tears starting to trickle down my face.

He stood with a smile and opened his arms and I ran into them without a second thought, wrapping my arms around his waist as I buried my head in his chest.

“I’ve missed you uncle Chris!”
113111221.title: Chris

113111222.content:
“NOOOOOOOOOO!”

“Sis… come on we need to get going. I don’t know what is going on but big brother Chris told me to get home and not leave. I think he was right. I have a feeling things are going to get bad really soon.”

I felt his hand tugging on mine and let him lead me away. I couldn’t stop the tears from flowing. He was dead. Blown into little bits. Why had he gone into the school? Why hadn’t he left with Billy?

The world passed me in a blur. It was all just random noises and flashing moments of darkness and light. It was over. Everything was over. Chris wouldn’t be there in the mornings to greet me. Or make witty one liners with his dry sarcastic voice. He wouldn’t be there to play along with my flights of fancy, or make me feel safe when I was scared.

I wouldn’t hear him tell me that he loved me anymore or see him glancing at me sideways when he thought I wasn’t looking. All the normal days were gone in an instant. Destroyed along with the school. He had somehow known all about this. Somehow he knew it was going to happen. He had been telling me goodbye before. Back before he had left me at the church. I had just been too stupid to realize it.

I wanted to tell him I loved him too. I knew that now. Funny how I only realized it after he was dead. I wanted to answer his feelings properly. But I couldn’t now. He’d never get to hear those words. Why had I been so stupid? So blind?

I blinked a few times and realized I was standing in the living room. When had I gotten here? When had we left the school? I needed to go back there. He might still be alive. It was possible. He could have escaped. He wasn’t allowed to be dead until I told him how I felt. Please god, just let him be alive! Let him somehow escape!

I turned to leave the room, fully intending to walk back to the school when my dad stepped in front of door and shook his head.

“It’s best if you stay inside honey. Billy told us what happened and I was out there. It’s not safe right now.”

“But he’s alive! He needs my help!”

“If he is still alive then the police will handle it. If you go out now you will end up getting killed and he wouldn’t want that now would he? There is rioting in the streets and a lot of madness all over town. It probably won’t reach this section though and the military is already enforcing order. I don’t want you to get caught up in it.”

Then what am I supposed to do?”

I heard the lost and pleading tone of my voice but didn’t care. The world was ending. Chris was dead and nothing my dad was saying made much sense. This was Gorgon City, where nothing really bad happened. There was no way there could be rioting. No way Chris could actually be dead. This was like what happened in a dream.

That was it! This was all a dream! I would wake up and none of this will have happened! All I needed to do was pinch myself awake. After all, Chris couldn’t cut off someone’s arm or climb trees without using his hands. He couldn’t do any of the stuff I had seen him do. He would never say the things he had said. Leaving me or Billy alone in a real crises and simply telling us to run home. That wasn’t like him.

I pinched my arm but nothing happened except I felt the sharp pain where I had grabbed. Maybe the arm wasn’t a good spot, maybe my cheek would be better. Still nothing. I had to find someplace more painful. I had to wake up.

My mom touched my arm, shaking her head when I looked at her.

“It’s not a dream sweetie. Doing that will do no good.”

I felt the tears beginning to well up again as she took me in her arms and rocked me back and forth.

“It’s ok sweetie. Maybe he did make it out. If he did I just know he will come running over here straight away. When he does I bet he is going to be really hungry. So let’s set a plate for him at lunch ok? You can cry your eyes out and make yourself look nice so he doesn’t have to worry about you when he comes. You know he will worry if you aren’t your usual self, because that’s just how he is. Now why don’t you help me prepare lunch ok?”

I slowly nodded my head against her chest and let her lead me towards the kitchen. She was right. He would come running as soon as he could. He always came running. He always found me when I was lost. Always knew the right things to say to make me feel better. And right now I was really lost and needed to hear his voice. Even if it was to make fun of me.

“Poor girl. She just can’t accept that he is dead. What is it about you mortals anyway? Whenever someone dies you almost always beg me to give them back to you. Yet ninety percent of the rest of the time you are either cursing my name or don’t believe I exist. It’s not all that easy to bring a person back to life you know. There is a natural order to things. Even I can’t mess with that order easily.”

“What did you think? I would make light of this situation? I’m not that heartless. I can appreciate such somber moments of loss as well. Even if I can’t completely understand it. Losing something or someone precious is always hard to handle. I hope she can get over this soon.”

I blinked and found myself staring at my reflection in the bathroom mirror. How long had I been standing here? How long had the water been running? Slowly I turned the faucet off and looked at my reflection again. My long blond hair seemed to have lost some of its luster and my blue eyes were rimmed red from so much crying. They had lost some of the life in them as well. Was this really what I looked like? I needed to fix this. I couldn’t let Chris see me like this. He would make fun of me for sure.

I ran a comb through my hair, holding it up in a few different positions. Deciding to wear it in a ponytail. He always had liked ponytails. Once that was done I used a bit of make-up and water to clear away the worst of the red around my eyes. When he came for lunch I would waste no time in telling him how I felt. He would like that. But that meant I had to be strong, I couldn’t cry anymore.

After leaving the bathroom I headed for the stairs. While passing Billy’s room I heard muffled sobs through his door. My own eyes began to water again, threatening to undo all the work I had just done. Clenching my fists I walked away. Chris was still alive after all.

Lunchtime drew near and I began to get anxious. What would he say to my confession? Would he kiss me again? Did I want him to kiss me again in front of my family? Would he laugh at how worried I was about him? If he did I would smack him. But that was just like him too. To simply laugh off a serious event like this.

As we sat around the table everyone seemed to be forcing themselves to act cheerful for my sake. I wasn’t worried. I knew he would come. I had set a plate out for him after all. I had piled it with mashed potatoes, some peas, and topped his hamburger steak with mushrooms. He loved mushrooms. It was ready and waiting for him. Now all he had to do was come over.

The doorbell rang just as I was about to put my first forkful of food in my mouth. I dropped it back to my plate as I bounded out of my chair. He was here! Just like my mom said he would be. I knew he wasn’t dead! I could feel my cheeks stretched to their fullest as I yanked open the door. My grin disappearing in an instant when I saw it was old Miss Haubenaker from across the street.

“Chelsea dear! What are you doing home? Shouldn’t you be in school?”

My hand dropped listlessly from the door as I turned to shuffle back to the table. My mom came around the corner and saw who it was while I moved away, all my energy suddenly gone again. I heard the old woman ask to borrow some sugar but I didn’t care. She wasn’t Chris.

Lunchtime passed but still he didn’t show up. I refused to let anyone take his plate off the table. He was going to be hungry when he came and hamburger steak was his favorite. Mom put some cling wrap over it but otherwise left it alone. With a sigh I shuffled into the living room and plopped down on the couch. aimlessly picking up the remote and flicking through the channels.

“At eight fifty three this morning Heronus middle school exploded from an attack made by a terrorist group calling themselves the Inquisition. Police and firefighters have been working tirelessly to clear the wreckage. Of the two hundred and twenty three children that attend this school only twenty two are still alive. Those who did not attend school today for whatever reason were the only ones not killed by the explosion. No other survivors have been found. A copy of the official attendance records for this morning are being pulled off an external server and the families of the victims are being notified as we speak. Stay tuned to GCNS for more info.”

No survivors. Of course there would be no survivors. It was impossible to survive a blast like that. I had been there after all. I knew there was no chance anyone could survive that. I let the remote drop back to the couch as my hands covered my face and I began to cry. The cushions next to me shifted as Billy sat down next to me. I latched on to him just like he latched onto me, our tears mingling together.

1132.title: That was Chel!

11321.content:
I stopped when my side began to hurt again. I was no great runner. I didn’t have much stamina. I was just scared. It had been stupid to just leave like that. To just run wildly from the house in the first place. I was stupid. Looking around I found I was standing in front of a bus stop bench with clear plastic walls and a roof. I sat down dejectedly, not even caring if those boys found me. I was lost, tired, hurt, and stupid. I wanted Chris to come save me. Even if he kissed me again I wanted him to find me like he always did and take me home. I covered my face as the tears began to fall.

“So, What’s the matter girl? You lost or somethin’?”

Chris had found me! I was so glad that he was here. I turned to yell at him for not finding me sooner and my voice caught in my throat. It wasn’t Chris. I didn’t even know this guy. He stood at almost six and a half feet tall and looked like someone had condensed down a building and stuffed it under his skin. He had a bit of a mean look on his face to as his deep inset black eyes watched me. I instinctively flinched back before I could stop myself.
